description:
Bottom line: go here!

What to get: any of the frozen yogurts, even the non dairy, with the mix in toppings, particularly awesome are the nuts and the almond butter. They mix in the toppings making it like an upscale heathlier version of a dairy queen blizzard. So different than all the other froyo places and a nice change from ice cream  and gelato sometimes. The puddings are really good too.

When to go: anytime of day. It's a small ice cream shop vibe so not a place to really sit and chat but there are a few tables inside and outside. This location is in the cute neighborhood of Hayes Valley too so nice place to walk around.
author: K R.

description:
Eh. This place is nothing too special. Just frozen custard with your typical arrange of toppings; cookies, syrups, etc. My strawberry shortcake was delicous but way too expensive for almost $6! The server/cashier had too much attitude. She didn't smile and had a flat affect. She wasn't entertaining or representing the company with passion; she didn't even answer my questions thoroughly. It was annoying lol.

Anyway, this place is ok.
author: Allister D.

description:
I came to Loving Cup with my boyfriend after a night at the San Francisco Symphony. As it was late, we didn't have many options, but we both had massive sweet tooth cravings and didn't want to have to walk too far. Luckily, I found on Yelp that Loving Cup was open and not too far of a trek from Davies Symphony Hall. 

The interior is large, bright, and airy - I was there at night but can imagine what a pleasant place this would be to hang out on a lazy Saturday or Sunday afternoon. We shared a large Dirty Hipster with a vanilla base, which came in a massive cup - it was almost too much froyo for the both of us. The Dirty Hipster is comprised of Oreos and Nutella, which is one of my favorite combos. All their frozen yogurts are freshly churned, and made to order, which is why your dessert may take a while to come out. It tastes heavenly, and decadent - definitely a little more indulgent than your typical froyo shop!

Overall, this place is a lovely creamery, although a little pricey (I forgot exactly how much, I think around $7-8 for a large?), but definitely worth the splurge if you are in the area and have a hankering for freshly churned ice cream! Although I personally loved the Oreos and Nutella combination, I would recommend ordering something that incorporates their fresher/non-prepackaged ingredients, like "fresh ground peanut butter, chocolate chunks, fruits and berries, house-made salted caramel, and locally roasted espresso beans" that they advertise on their website. These fresh and locally sourced ingredients might be where Loving Cup shines more; I will definitely experiment with new flavors when I'm in SF again!
author: Claire L.

description:
My go-to spot for froyo moving forward!! 

I stopped by here to end date night with some dessert. This place is located in Hayes Valley, which is not my go to spot in San Francisco because of parking. 

I ordered the banana bread froyo. Made quickly and you get a whole lot of it! I had to agree with babe that it was quite sweet. 

I will come back to try other flavors!
author: Elaine C.

description:
We were intrigued by the concept of blending the frozen yoghurt with the toppings. Ordered cookie dough. can't really taste the pure vanilla flavor because it's all mixed together. And it's super super sweet. With the Oreo and cookies, it's extremely sugar loaded. 


Would not recommend it. Not really frozen yoghurt and not really ice cream. Asked for a sample of pure vanilla fro yo but got a rejection from the lady
author: Carrie Z.

description:
Favorite dessert spot in SF, because they truly have Guilt-free and semi-guilt-free options yet retain the taste!

Maybe I'm too much of a health but, but when a shop has a vegan option of frozen swirled bananas (nothing else added) with mixins such as almond butter, Oreos, granola, Nutella, and peanut butter, just to name a few--I'm sold.

At loving cup, you choose a base--chocolate, vanilla, vegan (bananas), and one with coconut kilt + pea protein--then swirl in you choice of mixins from fruit, to nut butters, to cookies, and more. You can customize it or choose from their pre crafted combos, but you won't be disappointed.
author: Kyle S.

description:
Fro Yo heaven.  This churned to order fro yo is not your average fro yo.  It's the best frozen yogurt out there.  What makes them the best?  You pick a base of chocolate or vanilla, then you pick your "mix-ins" like pretzels and nutella -my personal fave, they have animal crackers, oreos, peanut butter, chocolate chips, strawberries, and all kinds of other delicious goodies.  They mix the toppings in by using this cool drill machine.  Makes the fro yo nice and thick and each bite is perfection.  Each cup is hand blended and fresh. 
If you aren't a fro yo person, their rice pudding is tasty and a must try as well. 

There's a few locations, I usually go to the one on Polk street.  It's located next to some awesome bars and restaurants.  Staff are friendly and cute ambiance.  During the week the close at 9:30pm, and on the weekends they close at 11pm.
author: Adrianna P.

description:
I really enjoyed Loving Cup! It is definitely a lot tastier than the typical frozen yogurt shop. It's fun to taste how the mixed in toppings transform the flavor of the yogurt. The special flavor when I went was matcha and it was delicious.
My only complaint is the speed. Since there are only a few machines, it takes a while to mix each yogurt in the machine and clean the machine after each use. If there is a line, be prepared to wait a bit to get your ice cream.
author: Emitom H.

description:
Maybe I ordered the wrong thing.

I've had Loving Cup bookmarked for years! I've been dying to come here, especially since I always see such delicious pictures on IG! So, while on our date night, I excitedly asked my boyfriend to take me to Loving Cup.

The staff at the counter was nice and helpful. He recommended the Peanut Butter Cup, which I was down for! Sadly, I wasn't impressed. Don't get me wrong, I love froyo and the fact that Loving Cup allows for customization is amazing. But, it wasn't particularly spectacular or different compared to other froyo places. In fact, I would prefer Yogurtland. I was most disappointed by the fact that the yogurt was not creamy, but more so icy-like.

On another note, this location in Hayes Valley is super cute and there are a fair amount of seating if you want to enjoy your dessert with some good company. That being said, I am disappointed with my experience here. Perhaps I just got the wrong item on the wrong day. I'm not sure, but I do want to give this place another try and see if their rice pudding is any better!
author: Julia L.

description:
We walked into this place looking for some hot beverages but only find frozen yogurt and rice pudding. But that is a happy accident.

I tried three flavors of rice pudding: rum raisin, cookie and creme, and coconut. I love the coconut and was told they roasted the coconut in House.

For the frozen yogurt, I had a hard time choosing a flavor and settled down on mocha chips. It does taste like ice cream but better!
author: Sunny X.

description:
First time visiting and I will definitely be back!

Shared a medium with my sister and it was plenty. We agreed on The Dude Abides, a chocolate base swirled with toffee and almond butter. It was phenomenal. My sister is not a huge chocolate fan and she kept up with me.

I was a big fan of make your own fro yo but I love that the flavors are mixed in. They have some really great options for mix-ins.

Another plus was that Loving Cup had a much shorter line than Salt & Straw, so if you want your dessert ASAP, head over there. I'm excited to return and try other combinations.
author: Roya B.

description:
Good frozen yogurt but more on the icier side than the creamy side. What is unique is that they mix in your toppings WITH the froyo inside the machine. Upside - consistent crunch, Downside - not as customizable. Pick your poison.

I ordered the Salty Dog - solid choice. It had pretzel bits crumbled up with salted caramel. 

Would I come back? Hm that's a hard question. The price is a bit steep and with Salt and Straw around the corner, I think I'd pick S&S each and every time. The price is $1 higher for a more satisfying, inventive experience. It depends what you're looking for!
author: Cindy W.

description: This maybe one of my favorite desserts. The dirty hipster is already delicious, but add strawberry and graham crackers. It'll blow your mind.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Located in Hayes Valley, this store front specializes in frozen yogurt and rice pudding!  It seem like this is one of the only places in the city that serves rice pudding, which isn't that popular with most people but has it's admirers.

They offer four different varieties of rice pudding. On my visit, they had Madagascar Vanilla bean, rum raisin, cookies and cream, and coconut.  I decided on the classic vanilla for my current trip. It was pretty yummy.

They also serve frozen yogurt here and have a plethora of mix in ingredients. You start a base of vanilla or chocolate and the first mix in is free.  Any additional is an extra 75¢.  A bit pricy, but it is standard San Francisco prices now.  

There are many frozen yogurt places around but this might be the only place I know which serves fresh rice pudding. Check it out if you want an alternative to the many ice cream and dessert locations in SF.
author: Jacky C.

description:
This place is freaking Delicious. I have never had vegan Ince cream that is so smooth and thick. It is absolutely delicious. 

The space is cute and the staff are friendly. Definitely come and check this place out!
author: Robert H.

description: Cute ice creamery in Hayes Valley, really popular with lines out the door on a Sunday afternoon. You can make your own concoction of frozen yogurt or choose from their dozens of flavors. I chose the Strawberry Shortcake with the vegan fro-yo option and my friend chose the Salty Dog. She really liked hers I thought mine was good but wasn't mind-blowing (might be coz of the vegan fro-yo, so less rich in flavors). Id still go back and try other flavors (and remember to bring my Lactaids so I can actually have the dairy ones!), all the flavors look fun!
author: Johanne L.

description: Cute little shop with friendly service to match. The few times I've tried this place, it wasn't too busy or overly crowded which is perfect for my people-phobic ass like myself. My go-to is the Dirty Hipster with Strawberries! The best! Their seasonal varies such as the pumpkin spice isn't too shabby either. Check 'em out!
author: Joon Y.

description:
I'm not a huge "sweets" person but happened to stumble upon Loving Cup yesterday after a quick business lunch nearby. The two women working gave me the lowdown on how everything worked as it's a bit fancier than your normal frozen yogurt shop. Pick your base, add your mix ins, repeat. 

I opted to go with one of their best sellers, the mint chip. It's vanilla frozen yogurt with Oreos and thin mints mixed in. Super legit. The order was quick and I had my treat in hand in a matter of moments. The yogurt itself was super high quality and I totally get the appeal of the concept. 

I'll totally be back the next time I'm in Hayes Valley as it's a great product.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
I recently discovered that this Loving Cup location has a Matcha Fro-Yo Flavor and ever since then, I've been hooked! I love coming here after visiting the Biergarden near by. It's the perfect place to end the night, especially if you're yearning for a sweet and "healthy" treat.

My favorite combination here is the Matcha Fro-Yo with Oreos & Salted Caramel. It's seriously addicting and the salted caramel sauce is one of the best I've had yet. If you're not craving yogurt/ice-cream, then you can also opt in for some milkshakes or rice pudding instead! The possibilities here are endless.

I also love how spacious this location is compared to the one on Polk Street. There is plenty of seating inside the facility if you want to enjoy your ice cream with some good company.
author: MyTien P.

description: Not particularly impressed by this place. I got the blueberry coconut cream and there are lots of chunks of frozen blueberries mixed into it. Very strong coconut taste and a tad sweet in my opinion.  Not bad, but not great either.
author: Tiffany C.

description: I have been to the Loving Cup at their original Polk St. location many times so was excited to see that they have expanded to a second locale.  This one seems a bit bigger than the first with more seating and the same winning offerings.  Since many places offer Fro-yo but very few does rice pudding well, we always veer towards one of the rice puddings.  They had four choices here vs. 6 that they use to have at Polk so would like to see more variety, especially the nutella which I have only had once but still memorable years later.
author: Joyce Z.

description:
Super cute yogurt place with bright, fun decor. That is what got my attention as I was walking to a workshop I was attending two doors down at local shop gather. 

The concept and experience is unlike your average yogurt shop in the way that your toppings don't just get put on top of your yogurt, but blended into it. I'll be honest, when I saw that they had rice pudding, that was what I was going for. However! I saw that the ingredients were blended into the yogurt, and I had to try that first. 

The flavor is good. The consistency is thick and creamy. I'm coming back for the rice pudding.
author: Lani S.

description:
Loving cup is a fun soft serve ice cream place! They have amazing soft serves you can choose from as well as their rice pudding! If you choose to get a soft serve, you get to choose vanilla or chocolate as your base along with toppings (up to 3 I believe!). They also have some options on the side if you can't choose what toppings you want. It's really fun to choose what toppings you want!

I personally chose the vanilla base with Nutella, pretzels, and Oreos! My favorite! 

They offer free wifi as well!
author: Katty X.

description: This review is only about their rice pudding, which I really enjoyed. They have a few selection, but it's really good. I come back to try different things each time.
author: LM D.

description:
Loving Cup is a wonderful build-your-own frozen yogurt shop! Start with a yogurt flavor of either chocolate or vanilla and then choose 2 or more toppings to be mixed in right in front of you before being beautifully presented in soft-serve form. They have sizes ranging from small (~5 oz) to a pint (~16 oz) and I highly recommend getting a larger size and sharing. 

Also, per their website, the frozen yogurt is pretty guilt-free with a small serving having only 120 calories (5g protein, 25g carb, 0g fat). My personal favorite is combining vanilla-cinnamon-pecan because of how satisfying and delicious, yet low-calorie it is (especially considering how many calories you could be getting with traditional ice cream like at Bi-Rite or Salt n Straw.

Get creative with the toppings combinations. You really can't go wrong with Loving Cup's frozen yogurt!
author: Phillip V.

description:
Food 5/5. Service 5/5. Ambiance 4/5. Bang for your buck 5/5. 

Holy dam! The rice pudding here is delicious. I have never seen a store sell rice pudding and I don't think I ever did have rice pudding here before. But on a whim, I decided to go in and get some - boy, was it good. 

They have an array of flavors in a cold case from lemon, cookies and cream, cinnamon and more. I just couldn't decide and tried most of them. All of them were packed with flavor, and the rice pudding was creamy, yet light. It had a consistency of rice porridge and wasn't too sweet. For a place in Hayes Valley the price was great, and a small size is perfect as the rice really fills you up.

Conveniently in the middle of Hayes Valley, this place is great for an afternoon snack or after dinner dessert. The service is great, and the rice pudding even better. Don't even come here for anything else. (Try the frozen yogurt through, it looks pretty good) 

Tips - Get the small cup for rice pudding, more than enough. 

Pros - The ambiance is great, and it's a convenient location. 

Cons - I wish there was one closer to me
author: Brian N.

description: Well crushed up and mixed toppings are swirled into the ice cream. The specialty flavors are cheaper since each topping (beyond the first one? Or maybe all) is an additional charge, which isn't clear from the list of flavors (I thought you got up to 3 for free).
author: Patricia P.

description: Bought a small cup of the coconut rice pudding on a whim after devouring a two scoop cone at the neighboring salt and straw. Couldn't eat anything else that night so had to save it. Ended up eating it in the airport at 6am before I flew home and it was amazing. I love rice pudding and this rice pudding was delicious. Great thick consistency, nice texture...rice cooked perfectly and was sweet but not overly and the coconut came through but wasn't overpowering. Would love to try the other flavors and the ice cream also.
author: Heather L.

description:
I had the medium Dirty Hipster yogurt (Vanilla, Nutella, Oreo).
it was really good, thick and crunchy (because of the oreo crumbs).
I haven't try their rice pudding yet, but I will.
it's only one block from home after all.
author: Rudy H.

description:
Love the concept of this place. Highly recommend blending up some solid toppings like walnuts or pretzels to get a satisfying crunchy texture in your yogurt. No matter how you blend it, it'll be unlike your regular froyo w toppings.

Also got the try the cookies and cream rice pudding which, I mean, how can you go wrong? The blended Oreo leaves small chunks of the creme filling throughout the creamy pudding, it's definitely more enjoyable than picking out the Oreo pieces in your regular cookies and cream ice cream. 

$4 for a small. It's in a cute neighborhood. (Dad says it used to be such a run down, bad area, now it's all up and coming hipster.)
author: Lilian K.

description: Love the Loving Cup! In a neighborhood with plenty of ice cream options like Smitten and Salt & Straw, this definitely is a little different because it's frozen yogurt. You can create your own combination but I like to get the Salty Dog (vanilla frozen yogurt, salted caramel and pretzels) from their set menu.
author: Lillian B.

description: Best frozen yogurt place in all os San Francisco! So many options and flavors! Very cute decor as well. Always have to come here when I'm in Hayes!
author: Joanna M.

description: Very plain flavor - can only taste sugar and flour, not creamy at all. Very regular fro-yo, extremely extremely sweet, not sure why it's popular - because it's just sweet I guess?
author: Yuzhou Z.

description:
Loving Cup is a fun soft-serve ice cream option. It's one of those places where they do truly mix in all your add-ins via a blending machine. I got the matcha with cookie dough and it was delicious, if somewhat expensive. A friend had the vegan option and we both found it disappointing - it's just frozen bananas without any added sweetness, and it tasted as such, so definitely not worth the cost.  

The only other blip on this visit was the staff- we were there a little after opening and the young man working there was visibly tired, curt, and into his phone. He seemed to begrudgingly do his duty with all the customers and although I can't fault him for having one of those days, his demeanor definitely affected the atmosphere in the store and it was awkward to have a cheery purchase met with a grunt.
author: Kim B.

description: Um why does this concept not exist elsewhere? It's like a gourmet McFlurry and I am so here for it. They're are so many potential combinations I got overwhelmed but ended up going with a English toffee and waffle cone. Still think about this soft serve all the time.
author: Brittany N.

description:
It was hard to find a dessert place near downtown SF that opens after 10pm. So I basically used Yelp to find whatever ice cream place that popped up first. I didn't know Loving Cup was actually a considerably well-known shop! 

The shop design was cute and modern, with lots of corner for you to take Instagram-worthy photos. All of us decided to get the fro-yo instead of rice pudding (despite we were super curious about it) because it looked kinda messy and gross. There were ALOT of options to choose from and I was kinda bewildered at all the choices. After legit 5 minutes of staring at the menh, I decided to have a vanilla blended with graham cracker, reaspberries and coconut. The medium size was very large and it could feed 2 people. My froyo turned out to be sweet and creamy, but I generally liked citrus and sour flavors. The raspberries were very sweet. I gave this place 4 stars because it was a bit expensive and that the flavors were not as exotic and unique(although it did taste good)
author: Nhi D.

description: It was alright -- I ordered the rice pudding and honestly have had better in Indian restaurant buffets. The frozen yogurt was nothing to write about it either. But overall a-OK.
author: David Y.

description:
I have been meaning to come here for awhile and was super excited to step in the other night. I tried a mango and raspberry with vanilla base frozen yogurt and my friend got a vegan almond butter (with banana base) "faux yo". 

There were a few things I noticed while watching them make our two orders. 
1. The process is super wasteful - for my small, they made probably 2x what was in my dish and just threw out the excess. 
2. The process is very inefficient - they use one single container for every order so they have to clean it out each time between every order. 

Now, for the amount of time/waste that goes into each cup, I was expecting explosive flavor and luxurious creaminess... and instead I got kind of icy and inconsistently textured frozen yogurt and the middle of the fish was hollow. 

The vegan one was worse. It sort of tasted like banana and in addition to being frozen and somehow weirdly chewy, also had the familiar thick,adhesive texture that bananas always have. To say it was a strange tasting experience is an understatement. 

While I want to support them and like their concept, Loving Cup needs to work on the enjoyability of their product. I don't care how much effort goes into this if the result is a $5 cup of bland iciness.
author: Quinn Li O.

description: Fulminantly overrated. Expensive, small portions, and poor service. During a crowded occasion, one guest accidentally took what turned out to be my order, ate part of it, heard his order, and placed my partially consumed order back on the counter half-melted. The staff announced it as my order and made no effort to replace it. Customers can get similar flavors elsewhere for cheaper.
author: P M.

description: We live in the South Bay and this is pretty much the must visit for us every time when we are in the city. The rice pudding and froyo are super delicious. The only problem is the parking.
author: Stanley C.

description: Love their ice-cream. I think it is the best ice-cream in SF. Many different flavors, tastes good, does not feel too heavy or too sweet, just right.
author: Sophie N.

description: Smooth yogurt.  Wow, they mix whatever you want.  So out if the main drag.  Walk to get here,  so consider work for your yogurt. Medium is too much for ine person.  Chicolate peanut butter was yummy.
author: Helen L.

description:
Very rich and smooth fro-yo with tons of blend-in options( rice-pudding isn't worth it though). Unlike Yogurtland (the fro-yo place I grew up with), Loving Cup only offers two bases: vanilla and chocolate. If you are craving something more tarty, this might not be the best place. But chocolate fans should know this chocolate fro-yo has a very good chocolate flavor--not too creamy either.

The raspberry add-in is frozen and not fresh fruit--I wasn't a huge fan of mini icy chunks in my fro-yo so I'll have to try different add-ins in the future. Also, additional add-ins after the 1st one are 75 cents each. 

Rice pudding is a no-go for me. As someone who grew up eating all types of rice, this cold dessert just reminded me of days when I had to eat goopy cold rice porridge for lunch. The pudding is there but so is the rice (same texture and taste as rice porridge). It was such a weird clash because I dont usually eat pudding/sweet stuff with my rice porridge.

They also offer a few smoothie options. 

The interior is brightly lit with cute, simple, and minimalistic decor. There are several inside and outside seating options but there's also a park down Octavia where you can go chill at if there is not enough seating.
author: Lydia Z.

description:
I am quite a fan of Loving Cup after trying it this weekend. There are a few tables around, but the room is very spacious and comfortable. 

I ordered the vegan "faux-yo" with peanut butter and Oreo pieces. The "faux-yo" is made of frozen bananas, so it is essentially banana "nice cream". A small costs more than $6, so it is quite pricey! Although, you do end up getting a good amount of yogurt in the small cup. The texture is extremely thick and creamy, and it feels like a very decadent dessert while still being healthy! It tasted quite banana-y however. I would recommend getting some more mix ins to make it taste more like yogurt or ice cream- the peanut butter and Oreos did not mask the flavor at all. Still, I enjoyed it, but it doesn't quite fulfill the frozen yogurt craving. 

I will definitely return, but I will try adding some more mix ins!
author: Ayushi A.

description:
Really cool mom and pop owned shop. Came here for dessert with my girlfriend after a nice dinner.

I was surprised to see rice pudding as part of their menu. Pleasantly surprised I might add because they had a couple varieties of flavors: cinnamon, cookies and cream, Madagascar Vanilla, etc.

We got the Cinnamon Toast Crunch flavor and cookies and cream rice pudding. Medium sized is a pretty big portion. If you're full and have room for dessert then a small is just fine. 

It felt kind of plain and empty. I guess because it's a big space. Appreciated the art work that was being sold on the walls. It tells me they are very into the community. Would definitely go again!
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Not your typical froyo place. If you're used to original tart froyo, be disappointed, cuz they don't have it!

This is more of a soft serve ice cream tasting type of froyo. Choose between vanilla or chocolate (or swirl both) and then choose a flavor addition. So basically its more like either vanilla or chocolate or swirl froyo with a flavor topping or addition.

The "yogurista" showed me that the yogurt bases come in packets..so they are obviously premade somewhere. 

The flavor additions all vary depending on the flavor. For example, the coconut I got was just some toasted coconut flakes added. Not preferable, cuz I love coconut froyo. It was still good, but definitely not what I really wanted . 

As another example, the pumpkin flavor would have been an added pumpkin mixture. Seems kinda strange honestly. Like chocolate plus pumpkin seems like too much going on. 

They are definitely unique with what they offer. So if you like soft serve ice cream, this is the place for you.

If you like tart froyo, this is not the place for you.

Service was on point, the "yogurista" really took the time to answer all my questions and explain and show me what the toppings were. Thanks for her patience!

My vanilla chocolate swirl w/coconut was creamy & decadent. A good level of sweet, not too over. Didn't melt on me, so it was not watery. 

Would I come again though? Maybe just to try their peanut butter. But other than that, not what I'm looking for in a froyo place. I'll still give it 4 stars for what it is though!

Plenty of tables for you to sit and chat, which is a plus!
author: Angela C.

description: We got the cookies and cream rice pudding & salty dog froyo! The frozen yogurt was delicious-- it was sweet enough to satisfy a sweet tooth while the blended up pretzels made for a delightful (and slightly savoury) experience. But the rice pudding is what I'll come back again for. How have I lived my whole life without trying rice pudding? I loved the consistency and though it was a tad sweeter than I would have liked it to be, it was an incredibly unique texture and I really have no complaints. Thank you for introducing me to rice puddings, I have now found my new favourite dessert.
author: Charmaine L.

description:
Sorry  Loving Cup, you are not my cup of tea or Fro-yo in this case. I am all for healthy and organic things. It was hard to decide what flavors I wanted and was surprised to see they had rice pudding. That's like an old time dessert I don't see often anymore, which is a nice addition to get the rice pudding lovers out there. 

Maybe I got the wrong flavor, but I got the Banana bread flavor which was vanilla, cinnamon, walnut and bananas. I see the huge machine grind and create the the fro-yo.  When I tasted it I know it's fresh and raw ingredients, but the texture of ingredients that were finely grind up didn't go well with me. I prefer smooth fro-yo. 

I know my review is one in few that gives this place a somewhat negative review. I wanted to like it, but I can't. 

It's perfect for those that are vegan and health conscious people who enjoy organic and raw ingredients.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
Love loving cup! It's one of my favorite dessert spot! I always go with a friend, one of us gets rice pudding and the other a yogurt and we share! The lemon rice pudding and coconut is my favorite but they are all tasty! A little on the sweeter side if you are sensitive to sweetness. You can also ask for a try! 
There are endless combos for yogurt! If you have a hard time choosing there are premixed options! The churn the toppings into the froyo in front of you. It is super fresh and a great firm consistency unlike self serve yogurt places. I usually go for something more fruity with vanilla but you can't go wrong really. 
There is also plenty of seating here so its nice if you're coming with a group or just want to sit for a while with your yogurt. The only negative is that it can be hard to find parking. It's a busy neighborhood! Overall a great place with fresh delicious desserts!
author: Andrea W.

description:
Located on Octavia St., Loving Cup is the perfect place to stop by when you're feeling like a cool treat. They take some of your favorite treats like junior mints, Oreos, animal crackers to gummy bears and finely blend them into a non-fat vanilla or chocolate base. They have a list of best selling combos on their menu but feel free to create your own. Start with the base and go crazy on whatever you'd like blended together.

I went with a customized cup. A vanilla base with cookie dough. The blend was light and delicious. Not overtly sweet but enough to kick my dessert craving. And their service is fast. Within 2 minutes I was already enjoying my blended concoction.

So if you find yourself in the area, stop by Loving Cup. You'll be in for a treat!
author: Christine D.

description: I was in SF on a rare toasty spring day, and after attending an outdoor event, this frozen yogurt really hit the spot. You can choose between a vanilla and chocolate base, then add in more flavors. They also have a pre-made menu of flavor favorites. I opted to make my own: vanilla and mango, and I was really grateful when I found mango chunks in my yogurt! Surprisingly the yogurt isn't too sweet, but it is VERY creamy. Huge fan, will be back on the next sunny Bay day ;)
author: Vicky N.

description: Love the yogurt and how it is a soft serve and comes in so many flavours!!! My friends ordered 5 different flavours and I had to say my favourite is the cookies and cream. A great little pick me up on a blue day.
author: Lesley Y.

description: Amazing icecreams made by combining the ingredients you want and mixing them all together into one single thing. They had nutella, banana, caramel, cookie dough, brownie and all kinds of fruits
author: Maria O.

description:
Two vanilla infused delights--froyo + rice pudding. Is it overpriced? Yes. Is it delicious? Yes!

FOOD: Loving Cup offers froyo made by the cup (with custom mix-ins) as well as some classic + creative takes on rice pudding. 

Froyo base is fantastic, and there's nothing more refreshing after dinner than having some berries blended in. The heavier picks are delicious if you have space too--the dirty hipster in particular (Oreos, coffee, and some other goodness) is a favorite of mine. 

Rice pudding is sadly average. For a lower price and higher flavor, I would opt for Trader Joe's rice pudding instead. The coconut flavor was fine, but given the subtle coconut flavor was more like rice pudding with coconut than coconut rice pudding. The cookies and cream was surprisingly good, but the cookies do get soggier than I'd like in the pudding (vs. ice cream, where the freezing retains a touch of the crunch). Overall, the price is so absurd that unless you are looking for a one-time organic blah blah indulgence, I would get the froyo and call it a day.

SERVICE: Order at the counter and sit down if you like. People are always nice at the register and surprisingly quick to turn out orders considering froyo is made one cup at a time on one machine.

AMBIANCE: Cute little Hayes Valley cafe that seats ~15 at most on stools and at tables. I love big paper stars, and they have a lovely one :). This is Hayes Valley, so there are lots of visitors here post-workout or with little kiddos.
author: Helen W.

description: One of my favorite places in the city! My go-to for awhile was vanilla with cookie dough and pretzels, because I'm usually craving something salty, but I recently was introduced to vanilla with strawberry and toffee! They have so many combos that you can mix and match with, but don't get crazy because every add on is $$
author: Carrie L.

description:
My gf has the sweetest sweet tooth and has the longest list of dessert places to try.  I've had my fair share of desserts back when I was in a relationship and all we did was eat.  That phase of hunting down every cookie/cupcake place has long passed.  Don't get me wrong, I still have cravings for deep rich moist chocolate cake from time to time, perhaps when Mother Nature visits, but I don't make it a point to visit these places.  BUT, when your gf asks you to accompany her AND your due for your weekly gossip, you shower and go.

Cookie Monster - Vanilla with Cookie Dough and Oreos.  I'm not a fan of froyo but the consistency was more like a hybrid of froyo/soft serve.  This wasn't bad but if I HAD to eat froyo/ice cream, I prefer chunks of cookies not pulverized ones

Love the simplicity of the place.  Friendly staff.
author: Linda N.

description:
Giving them 5 stars because of my favorite - Salty Dog!
I've tried a couple frozen yogurts from their place. This Salty Dog is the best to me so far.
author: Ariene S.

description:
Wow! Loving cup has set a new bar for froyo for me. I love froyo on a hot day so when my friend mentioned Loving Cup was nearby, I was in.

I got vanilla base with oreos and salted caramel on top. SO GOOD. The smallest size is generously portioned. My friend swears by the thin mint flavor. 

Wish they had one in the east bay...I'd be a regular! Looking forward to returning..soon.
author: Jasmine B.

description:
As a new vegan, I was CRAVING something ice cream-like but couldn't find any non-made up hipster-y gourmet place in the area. Loving cup has been a favorite for a few years now, so I decided to try a simple strawberry and banana froyo and it was divine! I was so satisfied with the taste of the fruit and because it was dairy-free, it lasted a long time and didn't melt haha

Highly recommended for vegans! Non-vegans, the Salty Dog (vanilla, caramel and pretzels) is a family favorite.
author: Angela H.

description:
While I feel like I generally do a good job when it comes to ordering, I know there are some definite goofs on my record.  Like the first time I ever tried Loving Cup.  Now, I'm not saying I did an awful job; I just don't think anyone would call my Chocolate Froyo, Strawberries, and Cookie Dough combination a classic.  Although, now that I think about it, it couldn't have been all that weird since it actually tasted pretty good!

Now, despite how the nearby Smitten gets more foot traffic and buzz, it'd be a mistake to overlook Loving Cup.  Specializing in rice pudding and hand churned frozen yogurt, their offerings are certainly more unique (I don't know of anywhere else that specializes in rice pudding).  What's more, their stuff is delicious!

As tempted as I was to get one of the tasty looking rice puddings from their display case, I knew I had to take another shot at their frozen yogurt.  However, instead of creating my own concoction again (you start with vanilla or chocolate froyo and then pick what toppings you want mixed in), I opted instead to go with one of their house favorite flavors - MOCHA CHIP (Chocolate Froyo with Espresso Beans & Bittersweet Chocolate Chips).

Though it may not be one of their more creative/interesting flavors, I still thought this was pretty darn good!  Texturally, thanks to the churning process that mixes in the toppings, the froyo has a sort of creaminess that's very unlike most varieties of frozen yogurt out there.  What's more, the chocolate flavor isn't overly sweet or bitter and is reinforced nicely by the bits of chips, as well as the espresso grinds.  Much better than my creation from before!

Besides the difference in my order, another reason why I enjoyed this experience a bit more than my first is because of how this location is quite a bit larger.  Compared to their original spot on Poke Street, this one is much more spacious, offering plenty of room for customers to wait for their orders without feeling cramped, in addition to a bunch of tables for people to sit and relax at.  Which is kind of a big deal when you just want to catch up with some friends or get a little cozy with your date.

FOUR AND A HALF STARS rounded down for now, if only because I'd still prefer a scoop of ice cream over froyo, but Loving Cup, I'll definitely be back to see you again soon!
author: Mike L.

description:
I truly love rice pudding. 

This rice pudding is woefully underwhelming: dull in flavor and watery in texture, it lacks the consistency that would let one actually call it pudding. This reminds more of cold oatmeal. Unfortunate.
author: John L.

description:
This review is long overdue. 

For the longest time I thought this was Loving Hut when passing by but then one day I took a closer look and realized my blunder. How? I don't know, the logo doesn't even look the same. Well, Loving CUP offers rice pudding and frozen yogurt - an addiction which I still have not recovered from. I haven't tried their rice pudding (last time I had rice pudding was Rice to Riches in SoHo maybe a decade ago) but probably will always opt for froyo over it. 

English toffee over chocolate and banana is my go-to but you probably can't go wrong with any combination. Portions vary depending on who dispenses the yogurt for you. It can vary from full cup to 3/4 of the cup filled or a hole in the middle which is annoying. 

Stays opened relatively late and that's always a plus!
author: Esther A.

description:
Pleasantly surprised to not only stumble upon this cute frozen yogurt place, but also the taste of it! This little gem is tucked away down a side street in Hayes Valley, and sometimes gets overlooked by the wildly popular Smitten, but it has its own posse of followers that keep it running strong! 

This place isn't too big, but enough seats inside to hang out with a small party of up to 4. They also fit a double stroller (for those moms of multiples or singletons out there. There are about two flavors of frozen yogurt, but lots of flocks combinations. There's also smoothies (which look delish) and rice pudding in a variety of flavors. I got a small Oreo and cookie dough with vanilla frozen yogurt. This place isn't tart but rather the frozen yogurt tastes like a DQ blizzard (probably with way less preservatives though). It was tasty in all the right ways and made me want more (but I thankfully restrained myself). 

As this place is a nice little walk from me, I definitely will be making this part of my daily walk pitstop. 

Likes:
-conveniently located
-nice options
-overall cuteness

Dislikes:
-not good for big parties
author: Tracy T.

description: This is for the Loving Cup on Sutter. The froyo is pretty good, but the service could be improved. They have a structured way they want you to order, but however I do it, it seems to be wrong. Today it took10 minutes to get my froyo. They closed at 5 and turned a lot of people away. Not much love here.
author: Fred S.

description:
So delicious!  My fav froyo/ice cream spot in all of the bay!

I've been to the Nob Hill location several times but was in Hayes Valley yesterday and wanted to check it out.

Loved it! Great service, free secured wifi; it was. A leading after Artis had no space so I picked up blue bottle, grabbed so froyo, and continued my Sunday fun day of grading.

Tried the party in mouth and added chocolate chips.  Yum!
author: Monica J.

description: When you buy a frozen yogurt, you can choose base taste first. I chose vanilla this time, and a staff mixed vanilla base and pistachio. It was yummy!! However, their base vanilla is almost a creamy ice cream, not like a frozen yogurt. But still good, and a staff is friendly. Unfortunately, they don't have a WiFi.
author: Yumiko H.

description:
I'm freaking out.  How many millions of yummy flavor combos can I make at this wonderful shop?  It seems endless!  If I come in every day forever I wonder if I can try them all??  Well! I guess that's just what I'll have to do....
Not a bad ambition at all.  All healthy & natural, not like the chemical powders the other soft serve yogurt places serve you.
The shop is super cute & staff really helpful.
I'm already working on tomorrow's flavor combo.
author: Sandra H.

description:
Loving Cup = Frozen Yogurt + Rice Pudding

Frozen Yogurt. You start off by selecting a base of either vanilla or chocolate. The first mix-in is free, but they charge $0.75 for every subsequent one. Rather than simply sprinkling the toppings on top, Loving Cup differentiates itself by actually churning them into the froyo. This causes the ingredients to get evenly spread out in the yogurt. The result is a product with a smooth and creamy consistency.

// Vanilla Frozen Yogurt, Nutella, Cookie Dough ($3.75 small + $0.75 extra topping) - 4 stars
Even with two rich toppings, this froyo maintained a level of sweetness that wasn't overpowering at all.

Rice Pudding. They serve a variety of flavors: bittersweet chocolate chip, cookies n' cream, pecan praline, cinnamon rum raisin, Madagascar vanilla bean, and coconut. Although you can't sample the froyo, definitely have at it with the pudding!

// Cookies and Cream Rice Pudding ($3.75 small) - 4 stars
This chocolatey pudding was light yet flavorful, perfect for tapioca lovers.

ProTip: The recommended flavors in the "Fro-Yo Favorites" section each have 2 toppings in them. These actually cost the same as if you had selected any other pair, so just pick whichever ones you really want.
author: Miko B.

description:
I heard Loving Cup has the best rice pudding in SF so of course I had to try it!  

I was a bit disappointed at the selection though but maybe because I came in late at night?  They only had 5 flavors of rice pudding available - cookies and cream, bittersweet chocolate chip, cinnamon rum raisin, madagascar vanilla cream and coconut.  You can get them in different sizes as well - small ($3.75), medium ($4.75), large ($5.75) and pint ($7.75).

We settled for a medium size in cookies and cream.  Compared to rice to riches in NY... I think loving cup is slightly better!  It is definitely not as heavy and it feels sort of light which I like!  This place is very cutesy as well.  I definitely recommend this place to any rice pudding lovers out there!
author: Racheal D.

description:
Wow this place is so cute. Marble tables, chairs, benches, and stools. They have rice puddings with different flavors and different types of frozen yogurt. It isn't self serve either! 

What I got: dirty hipster

What it tasted like: ferrero Roche? If I spelled it correctly but it tasted exactly like it. Chocolate with Nutella and Oreo. Very very good. Mm mmm

I tried my friends' Cinnamon Toast Crunch which tasted like pumpkin spice because it was topped with cinnamon and my other friend got vanilla yogurt with espresso grinds and she loved it because it literally tasted like coffee. Bitter just the way she liked it. 

Would I return? Of course.

Ps I also tried an Oreo rice pudding, not too sweet but still very very good. If you're a fan of rice pudding come to LOVING CUP!
author: Ameenah M.

description: This used to be our favorite spot back when they had the non dairy plain flavor without chocolate or vanilla. Now they pulled that away, or at least half of there staff thinks they have, my gf and I used to love this place but won't be returning unless that hanged. The worst part is I'm pretty sure they still have it and the staff just doesn't know because it varies based on location -- terrible management and/or understanding of the customer, tough to know which.
author: Zach H.

description: I like the cookies and cream rice pudding. This place is famous for their froyos in which are customizable to your liking. They have two locations in the city and this is my go to one absolute fav!
author: Kevin L.

description:
Tbh I'm not a BIG frozen yogurt fan so I wasn't over the moon when my friend suggested we come here, but I am so glad we did! I ordered vanilla with espresso and I have to say, hands down one of the best coffee flavored desserts I've ever had. It was the perfect amount of bitter and wasn't underwhelming like other coffee flavored ice cream I've had. Usually the fro yo I've had are always really soft and melt quickly, but the quality at Loving Cup is super thick. I always order my smoothies extra thick, is that just me??

The decor is aesthetically pleasing and the employees were really friendly. I would be back again and again if I lived in the area!
author: Christina H.

description:
Super solid frozen yogurt--got the salty dog with the pretzels and salted caramel and it was the perfect combination. Tried the rice pudding too--wasn't quite what I was craving at the time, although it was certainly tasty!

I'd come back here for the frozen yogurt, especially since it isn't like the typical self-serve joint with flat flavoring. It is slightly expensive for the portions, however.
author: Nolan C.

description:
Gavin is the best yogurista out there; he goes above & beyond to please the customers and is the sweetest and nicest person ever. He always has a smile and a positive attitude whenever I come in and it makes coming to loving cup just THAT much better 

PS: get the Cinnamon Toast Crunch if you're unsure of what to get--you won't regret it
author: Emily S.

description: One of my favourite places for frozen yoghurt! Definitely recommended. Try the Cookie Monster one.
author: Mira B.

description:
After dinner, my friend and I decided to get some dessert and we found that Loving Cup was pretty close! The little shop is quite cute with some nice star lights in the windows. When we first got there around 9PM, there weren't that many people which is great, but the line quickly picked up after we sat down and the staff here was quite busy! 

We sampled the rice pudding, but we both decided we couldn't really finish a cup of it so we decided to go for the Dirty Hipster that everyone raves about. The Dirty Hipster froyo is a vanilla based froyo with nutella and oreo. I really liked the nutella flavor and the oreo crisp gave it a really nice crunchy texture! The froyo wasn't evenly mixed throughout which was a bit annoying, but the froyo was great nonetheless!
author: Catherine S.

description:
Randomly found this place.
Ambiance is very cute with a shelf full of nutella jars.

Ordered the dirty hipster which consists of oreo and nutella. It was incredible! For a vegan ice cream it had amazing texture. Only downside is that for the serving the ice cream is on the pricey side.

Also there was only one worker working there which was odd.

Overall very tasty place to get a vegan ice cream fix once in a while.
author: Michele G.

description: I don't usually gravitate towards froyo but Loving Cup definitely tipped my tendencies! I like how the flavors are not too sweet. I have yet to try the rice pudding and the raved matcha flavor that is now out!
author: Yumi H.

description:
Found Loving cup on Yelp, & decided to give it a try! Loving cup serves rice pudding and froyo.  Upon entering the shop, it was very modern and clean.

Unlike most frozen yogurt shops, they only have two base frozen yogurts, vanilla and chocolate.  After choosing a base you can choose 1 topping to be mixed in for no extra charge.  Or you can also choose a pre-selected mix and add another topping for no extra charge.  Every extra topping is $.50.  

Personally I've never had froyo like this before.  The toppings are perfectly blended in and result in entirely new and unique flavors from the original vanilla and chocolate.  I got a vanilla base with strawberry and marshmallow topping, and it was magically delicious!  The bf got chocolate base with strawberry and his was also delish!  We will definitely be coming back and will try more yummy combos!
author: Nina W.

description: Pretty good rice pudding. I usually get the rum raisin. The frozen yogurt is good as well with the customized options. Its not like the cheaper self serve powder yogurt shops hence why the texture isnt as smooth.
author: Ernest M.

description: Hands down the best frozen yogurt shop in the Bay Area. They use fresh organic yogurt and you can taste the freshness as opposed to the powdery stuff most other shops use. All their toppings are fresh as well. This makes it a great guilt free treat. Also, the salty dog is phenomenal!
author: Taimur A.

description:
Cute shop in Hayes where they churn the frozen yogurt custom to your order. The interior is pretty cute, with small jars filled with their toppings and tables to sit inside at. When I went on a Sunday afternoon there was no line. 

They charge 75 cents per topping you add to the 'base' which comes in either chocolate or vanilla. Something to note is that they have pre-made 'flavours' that have two 'toppings' in them, such as 'Dirty Hipster' etc. They price these the same way as if you make your own, so they'll charge you for the two toppings. It wasn't that clear based on the signage, so just something to take note of. I got a pre-mixed flavour 'cookies and cream' which was vanilla base with oreos and cookie dough mixed in. I really like that the toppings get mixed INTO the froyo itself. It was something that I haven't really experienced before.

They also sell rice pudding in different flavours! I sampled one of them and it was pretty good! It has a really interesting texture. I'll try that the next time I go.
author: Theresa L.

description: The ice cream here is bomb, but I go here just for the churro rice crispy treats! It's a must buy
author: Mark H.

description: Loving Cup is truly good place. Since I went for my first time by accident I was really happy with the service, wait and price. I think the sizes they offer are truly reasonable and I think the prices are nice. I mean nothing is very cheap in the city when it comes to food.
author: Zac D.

description: A unique frozen yogurt joint, Loving Cup isn't your typical self-serve/multiple flavor place. Instead, you order at the counter and pick a base flavor of either vanilla or chocolate, into which is blended a variety of toppings of your choice! I got the cookie monster, which was vanilla froyo with oreos and chocolate cookie dough--the froyo itself was decent, but having the toppings mixed and blended in was certainly the memorable part, as they added fantastic texture and flavor to the creamy yogurt. I also tried the vanilla with pumpkin puree, which tasted a lot like ginger. Overall, a unique and fun place for a quick and light dessert!
author: David K.

description: Great product but horrible business management. Hours state they are open but they are closed. Came from a distance and tried calling multiple times to make sure they are not sold out of brownies like before. Decided to risk it, sat in traffic and they have a closed sign with people behind the counter. And I people are in there, but still refuse to pick up there phone. Also, no answering machine that states if they are open or not.
author: Tim V.

description: Server/check out guy was kind of rude - but mmmh tasty. Got the Dirty Hipster and it hit the spot.
author: Ankita K.

description:
Loving cup is great, when they have inventory.  The menu lists "faux-yo", a vegan alternative to frozen yogurt.  I live less then 2 blocks away from loving cup and I go there at least 4 evenings a week looking for a cup of faux-yo.  I'm lucky to get it more than once a month.  The staff always tells me that they're out, and this has been occurring for over a year.  I've heard similar complaints from several friends who are vegan or have dairy allergies.

That being said, loving cup serves delicious deserts, and has a pleasant atmosphere.  I just wish there was more consistent availability of the vegan option.
author: Chris T.

description: How do I explain this place ? It's like a fancy mcflurry ? But so much better. Their base yogurt is delicious in itself and with the add ins it's just brings it to a new level. I went with a few friends and got to try 3 different yogurt combos as well as their coconut rice pudding. All of them were very good and I will definitely be back !
author: Celia Z.

description: One of my favorite frozen yogurt spots int he city! They have amazing soft serve that is different than any other place, because they mix the toppings in the actual soft serve! First, you choose a base, and then you choose the toppings and they will be able to mix in with the base flavor. I particularly love the option of the house "Salty Dog," which has caramel and pretzel :) so freaking delicious! My go-to every time :)
author: Micah L.

description:
Loving Cup was okay. It's not particularly spectacular and I wouldn't go out of my way to go there, but they make a solid froyo.

The fact that you can customize it means that you can basically mix and match your own flavors which I liked since I was able to make strawberry pistachio. In a way, it vaguely reminds me of coldstone, but with froyo instead of ice cream.
author: Annie Y.

description: came here excited, but fruit is just frozen and when they mix it with creamy vanilla ice cream you taste the ice crystals. I would take chocolate next time.
author: Johann F.

description: First time here and in love! Hayes valley is a great location and it's spacious and well decorated. Awesome concept and very good! Definitely recommend! Will be coming back when I can.
author: Brielle W.

description:
I'm usually not a fan of rice pudding but theirs is excellent.

You can have your yogurt in hundreds of combinations but I just go simple.
author: Evan W.

description: Delicious frozen yogurt. They make it in a very unique way. First you have to choose the base yogurt, either vanilla or chocolate then add fruits in it like mangoe, banana, raspberry, strawberry, Oreo etc. it's a must try frozen yogurt.
author: Sumbal A.

description: Meh...pricey for a cup of yogurt. It didn't really stand out to me.
author: Ellen C.

description: Surprisingly light and delicious! We got the dirty hipster and mocha chip. I like how they blend together the ingredients rather than toppings on top. I like that you can either build your own or pick from the list of special combos. Great location right in Hayes Valley and a great substitute if you're looking for something a little lighter! I didn't feel stuffed after eating it. Definitely going back again, next time want to try vanilla + berries.
author: Monika V.

description:
I stopped by on a Saturday evening with my friends since we were craving something sweet and leaving someplace nearby. Prior to coming here, I had never tried rice pudding before but had always wanted to visit Rice to Riches in NY!
During my visit, the rice pudding flavors available were coconut, Madagascar vanilla, cookies and cream, and cinnamon rum raisin. I wished there was more flavor variety but they probably ran out of other flavors since it was later in the day and a weekend. 
I got a small vanilla rice pudding with black bottom (chocolate ganache) and was very impressed!!! The rice pudding was light and had a good vanilla flavor. I especially liked that it wasn't too sweet! My friend got the coconut rice pudding and I really liked hers too even though I'm not a fan of coconut flakes. 
I'm glad I got to try rice pudding in the bay and would definitely return!
author: Vivian N.

description: This banana bread flavor is the best !!!! And the rice pudding rum raisin is super good !! Overall great place the only thing is the super young employees with the attitudes.
author: Demario P.

description: Oreo Rice Pudding. OMG. Its like eating ice cream but without the coldness, but like a chewy texture exploration. SO GOOD.
author: Jon H.

description:
My FAVORITE dessert place in SF, hands down. I love that they have a stamp card since I've blown through quite a few of those already. Loving cup's concept is quite unique in that they have you start with a frozen yogurt base and allow you pick toppings (which range from anything from mango to nutella), which they then mix together in a machine. 
I usually always choose from the specials, with the Dirty Hipster (Oreos + Nutella) and the Mocha Chip (espresso+chocolate chips) being my favorite. They also conveniently have two locations, so definitely recommend trying next time you are around!
author: Nidhi M.

description: Loving Cup has delicious frozen yogurt!  You get to choose your flavor (vanilla or chocolate) and then choose your mix ins.  I got chocolate yogurt with oreos and junior mints ("thin mint") and my boyfriend got vanilla yogurt with oreos and cookie dough ("cookie monster").  We both loved it. The service was great and I really liked the atmosphere of the place as well.  In a great location.
author: Sarah R.

description:
Ever since my first visit to Rich to Riches in NYC, I wondered why rice pudding shops with pudding by the pound were not springing up everywhere.  In NYC, there are lines around the block for this magical, caloric, sweet gloppy goodness. NYers were always a little ahead of the dessert curve.

Loving Cup is an adorable spot in Hayes Valley specializing in rice pudding (which is what got us in the door) and in custom blends of extremely rich frozen yogurt. The rice pudding selection is slim compared to its NY doupleganger, but all the offerings looked delicious. Our order of cookies and cream was a sugar bomb.

in the frozen yogurt, is there any self-respecting foodie that admits to liking the stuff?  Usually its about the toppings. Even words like hand spun and pro-biotic that make the medicine go down with slightly more superior feeling karma aren't the deal here: it's the taste.  Ethos aside, the yogurt here is delicious and custard like. You'll be surprised how rich it is.  I did a simple blend in of marshmallow into their base chocolate, and was pretty happy with that.  They have recommended blends with three and more combinations, and all sounded creative and varying degrees of delicious. Cups and spoons are compostable, so you can feel even better.

There was barely anyone here at around 6pm on Friday night, but I ask you San Francisco, is there anything wrong with eating rice pudding for dinner?  It may be  time to take that notion seriously.
author: Rachel H.

description: Being that I love any type of dessert, this place was ehh. My husband ordered a P'B Malt Shake and it was nasty! Tasted like a nasty, thick protein shake... I ordered the Dirty Hipster which was Vanilla frozen yogurt blended with Nutella & oreo cookies which is why I rated it 3 stars because this was actually good.
author: Michelle I.

description:
Great spot for fro-yo and rice pudding! You can customize either with several toppings. The consistency of the fro-yo is awesome and it's obviously much healthier than ice cream.

I got the vanilla fro-yo with salted caramel and pecans - delicious! 

Definitely recommended :)
author: Farid V.

description: Can't believe I never knew of this place! I really dislike smitten ice cream and glad I found this gem! Delicious fro-yo and they blend the toppings within the ice cream instead of on top which makes the ice cream pop in every bite!
author: Laura D.

description:
Meh! Rice pudding with Oreos mixed in? I'd take my calories else where... Like the smitten ice cream in the park...
Edible? Sure... 
I also sampled a lemon flavor, and that was a bit more promising, but my husband wanted to get the Oreo and it was not good enough for me to get one. 
They definitely get stars for creativity, but wish the experience was as good.
author: Marianna K.

description: Gotta come here to try their infused ice cream/froyo! This place is not like your typical froyo, it's BETTER!  First you choose your froyo base, either chocolate or vanilla. Then you get to choose your toppings to be blended with your yogurt. I got their chocolate base infused with oreos and nutella (medium size cup). It tasted AMAZING! They give generous amount for $6, not too pricey. It was super creamy and not too sweet. Every bite I took had oreo bits in it, it was delicious. The flavor was all there, tasted exactly what I ordered. They also offer vegan froyo for extra $1. Their froyo is all non-fat and have probiotic in it which is good for the gut. Hands down great place to visit for some healthy dessert!
author: Noel K.

description: My friends and I were really depressed about seeing a dog on the highway, and seeing it almost get hit by cars before it was rescued, so we stopped here for a treat. I got a vanilla base froyo and blended in Oreos and Nutella. It was heavenly. The space is big and has cool decorations and a shelf full of Nutella. The froyo was the best froyo I have ever had and I would recommend this shop a lot. I like how you can customize it, and the quality of the froyo is great.
author: Summer B.

description:
Good dessert, at reasonable prices, in San Francisco? Crazy talk.

But seriously, Loving Cup takes your standard froyo to the next level. I didn't have much time to check all the options on their menu, but I got the Cookie Monster which is vanilla yogurt blended with oreos and cookie dough. The whole "hand-churned froyo" thing seemed like a gimmick, but it's kind of cool how evenly all the toppings get mixed in, and it tasted significantly better than what I expected from froyo. 

And the price! ~$4 for a decently sized cup of froyo with toppings? Amazing.
Can't wait to try it again.
author: Gautam G.

description:
TLDR - unique froyo with flavors/toppings blended in, but not super special otherwise. pricey if you want several toppings and flavors aren't as strong as normal froyo

Interesting and unique in concept, but the actual result isn't that much better from other froyo in my opinion. Unlike most froyo places where you choose your flavor(s) and then add toppings on top of the froyo, Loving Cup only has two flavors of froyo - vanilla and chocolate - and has a number of "toppings" that are actually blended into the base flavors. They have a few base-topping recommendations, but with this concept, there's essentially an endless number of froyo flavors you can create. 

The only problem and the biggest reason I struggle to give Loving Cup more than 4 stars is the price. A small cup is $3.75 (medium $4.75, large $5.75), which includes only one topping. Any additional topping is an extra $0.75. I don't think it's worth paying more than $4 for a small cup of froyo, which basically limits my froyo creations to basic flavors that would be equally as good or better at other places. 

I ended up getting the VANILLA BASE WTH ESPRESSO ($3.75), so basically a coffee/espresso froyo. The texture of the froyo is pretty smooth and creamy, but I would've liked a much, much stronger flavor, which I think would be hard to accomplish in general given Loving Cup's concept. 

Since I like more intense flavors in general, I honestly wanted to give the froyo just 3 stars, it gets an extra star for the unique idea. They also have various rice puddings here. I haven't tried them yet, but might opt for one of those next time.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Hooray to Loving Cup for opening their second location here in the Hayes Valley. 

This wonderful rice pudding and frozen yogurt is perfectly situated on the corner of Octavia with a much bigger space.

They have indoor and outdoor seating. Friendly staff and of course their delicious treats. Go treat yourself with some of their decadent pudding. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: I was finished getting glasses at the nearby Warby Parker and decided to walk around. I came upon this place and saw a few people outside but it was quite empty inside and I haven't had flavored rice pudding before so I decided to give this place a try. I ordered the cookies and cream rice pudding. The interior could be better, I would prefer wooden table instead of like these marble/white looking tables. The menu is quite nice but it is confusing. I asked her how I ordered the frozen yogurt and then after I ordered another customer came in and asked the same question. First you pick a base , then you pick a add -on the first one is free and each additional is $0.75. I felt like the cashier/owner wanted me to order quick and wasn't that friendly. I will not be coming back. nothing special and I think its a lil too pricy
author: Brian C.

description: I really wanted to love this place cause the idea is so cool.  They take vanilla or chocolate frozen yogurt and mix it up with pretty much almost anything you can think of within reason.  Basically custom blizzards.  Really liked the vibe and the service but the goods themselves are just okay.  It really would have made it if it was soft ice cream or even frozen custard.  Yes, not quite as good for you but who are we kidding?  It would have tasted so much better!
author: Ronny T.

description:
In short, I want to come back and try other flavors! They have frozen yogurt, rice pudding, shakes, and baked goods. 

As another reviewer put it- Loving Cup is Cold Stone for frozen yogurt! Choose a base flavor, pick toppings, and then they blend it together and WA LA! Loving dat cup in front of you. You can make your own combo or choose from a list they have

Based on yelp suggestions, I ordered the Salty Dog froyo (vanilla base + salted caramel + pretzels). I like crunch and would have preferred more pretzel texture in there. The Dirty Hipster (vanille base + nutella + oreos) is their other popular froyo flavor. I want to try that one next. 

Their rice pudding is good! I tried my friend's basic vanilla one, and I was a fan. The cinnamon rum raisin is delicious (I asked for a sample). 

For all your health conscious folks, a 5 oz serving of froyo is 120 calories. A small serving of rice pudding is 190 calories. Nutrition info courtesy of their website, ya dig?

This location is interesting because there's also apparel being sold in here. Never seen a dessert + clothing store combined, but hey- that's cool.
author: Joanna L.

description:
I loooooveee this place for their frozen yogurt. 

You choose your base (Vanilla or chocolate) then you choose your toppings.
Then you watch your frozen yogurt magician take a disc of froyo out and dump it in along with your topping in this cone like contraption! It's so amusing to watch! 

Since they don't have a berry base, I always choose blueberries with my vanilla and watch it transform into this awesome purpley blue froyo!

Super duper yummy, definitely stop by here if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Kelly L.

description: This place is pretty good. But reeks of privilege and pretension. Not to mention staff isn't at all friendly. Don't ask for any suggestions because they'll look at you as if you asked for their left lung. Prob won't be coming back for a $6 small cup of froyo
author: Paige N.

description:
Cool concept of creating your own frozen yogurt flavor, but mine just tasted a little weird. The flavor seems a little muted. I got the vanilla base with espresso, walnuts, and Nutella. It just had a weird after taste. for $4.75 a cup, this just isn't worth it. 

Also got the Coconut rice pudding. It wasn't anything special-kinda tasted like horchata rice pudding. Overall, the flavors here are just a little bland for my taste.

Wouldn't come back tbh.
author: Alicia L.

description:
Got the DIRTY HIPSTER, which is a vanilla based slow churned fro yo with nutella and oreos mixed in.

The fro yo was good and the price was reasonable, but i think they could definitely make some improvements.

This place fell short two stars because (1) the fro yo was just way too sickly sweet and (2) the texture was icy, rather than creamy.

I think this is a great idea and the people who work here are fun and enthusiastic. Its also a great location to grab some fro yo and have a walk outside.

If I return, will try the rice pudding!
author: Kimia M.

description:
I love this concept. It's pretty much an upscale, customizable McFlurry. You choose chocolate or vanilla ice cream and then you get to pick an unlimited amount of toppings that you would like blended into your ice cream. They have some pre-picked items on their menu, for those of you that can't decide what topping will go well together. 

The service was a little slower when I went because there was only one person working and a crowd of kids came in. But the wait is not that bad. Tip: If you want marshamallows, ask for it on the side or sprinkled on top. If you get in blended into your ice cream, the marshmallow will actually just get lost in the ice cream, and you won't even be able to tell there was any marshmallow there to begin with.
author: Sophia P.

description:
We were looking for dessert and I wanted ice cream but he did not. I suggested Loving Cup and both of our requests were satisfied.

I had the vanilla froyo base with mixed in raspberries. It wasn't cheap ($3.75 for a "small") but they did have to put in a decent amount of work to make it happen so I suppose it's worth it. The vanilla base tasted average and I did appreciate that the overall concoction was not too sweet.

As far as I could tell, he seemed to enjoy the rice pudding.

A few days later, another group of friends wanted to check out Loving Cup. We arrived at 11:15am on a Sunday and although Yelp and their own website said it opens at 11am, it was not open and seemed to be closed for at least another hour. It's really annoying when businesses do not have consistent business hours.
author: Yi Z.

description:
My friend and I stumbled upon this place while spending the Saturday in Hayes Valley. We were not having it with the line at Smitten and needed to not get Blue Bottle Coffee aka break the routine. 

The concept of Loving Cup is great: mixing in fresh flavors into your frozen yogurt. It's like if Coldstone and quality froyo and ingredients had a love child, it would be Loving Cup. There is a lot of variety and the preset combinations all sounded amazing.

I ended up keeping it simple with a vanilla base and Nutella mix in. It was so delicious. There was a good frozen yogurt to Nutella ration. I really hope I can come back soon and try everything else out. 

I've seen some of the comments about the service not being friendly and I definitely have to agree. I didn't really feel welcome in the store.. And all I wanted was to get some frozen yogurt. A smile really never hurt anyone. 

3.5 stars. 4 stars for the food and 2.5 for the service.
author: Kathryn T.

description:
Fun little place in the heart of Hayes Valley! I tried them after dinner for a yummy frozen yogurt mixin'. I tried vanilla with nutella and oreos. The yogurt base is perfectly sweet (not overly sweet!), smooth, and the blending was perfect. I will totally go back if in the area and want something sweet. 

They had different types of rice puddings too but to be honest, I would not be quick to try it. The presentation in the window display is not appetizing at all. 

One recommendation for management - the person I was with ordered a peanut-based mixin' and hers was made before mine. Then, when I tried mine, I could taste peanut butter. I like peanut butter so not a big deal to me at all, but if someone is allergic, I would recommend cleaning the machine before making the next customer's order.
author: Anna M.

description:
Two wonderful offerings: Frozen yogurt and rice pudding. 

Great place to grab a sweet treat. 
Friendly service. 
Lots of seatings and marble tables.
author: Deborah C.

description:
Amazing frozen yogurt and rice pudding. From the quality of the taste, you definitely can tell everything is handmade. We got a froyo and a rice pudding, while both delicious, the rice pudding really stood out! It's so hard to find shops that make rice pudding which is terrible because it's such an underrated dessert :( Be sure to sample their rice puddings, I recommend the bittersweet chocolate chip!

For the frozen yogurt, you get to choose your base (non-fat vanilla or non-fat chocolate), and your toppings. The first topping is free and each one after is $.75. The cool part is that they blend your toppings with your base and all your toppings are evenly distributed in your cup of froyo. We got vanilla with strawberry and junior mints and the strawberries basically made it strawberry froyo haha. 

I think the price is a little steep but it's definitely a high quality dessert, good for any occasion. Highly recommend :)
author: Jingxi Z.

description: Best Frozen yogurt I have ever had! I have never tried a yogurt place that actually blends the ingredients you choose into your yogurt! And the best part is they use lactose free milk! There best flavour is the Cookie Monster which I recommend everyone to try!
author: Yuli S.

description:
I ordered a salty dog froyo and a Madagascar vanilla bean rice pudding.

The froyo tasted like a butterfinger! The first few bites were amazing, but after a while, it was a little overwhelming. Don't get me wrong, it was hella good, but I got tired of the taste. It had a good balance of sweetness and saltiness, but I'm more of a fruity person, so I want to try the fruit flavors next time. 

The rice pudding was great! I never had rice pudding before, but I really enjoyed it. It wasn't too sweet and the flavor was good. Oh and the workers let you sample the rice pudding!

The price is okay and not a lot of places have rice pudding, so this place is pretty great!
author: Tara T.

description: I first tried Loving Cup at another location and I was hooked! However, after stopping by the octavia location I was pretty disappointed. The portion of my froyo was SO SMALL The server somehow managed to just fill half of the cup and left the other side unfilled )= For 5 bucks you would expect at least a decent serving size. My advice would be to maybe ask the server to fill it up to the top?? :/
author: Mary L.

description:
Tried the vegan "faux-yo" which is banana based mixed in with some cookie dough and nutella (of course). Quick service considering how many orders they had to get through. The banana base is over-powering though, and while it was good, it was hard to distinguish any other flavor. Perhaps they should consider a soy or coconut or almond base, so their mix-ins have more of an effect. 

As an aside, it would probably be more useful to put names or numbers on the cups. Calling out the type/mix-in was ineffective and people just seemed to be confused.
author: Lydia L.

description:
Came here on a hot day intending to get some froyo, but then I tried their cookies and creme rice pudding and it was amazing! I was left conflicted between getting froyo or some rice pudding, and ended up with froyo since it was so hot. 

I got the salty dog (vanilla froyo with pretzels and house made salted caramel). It was delicious! I love the crunch it gave. However, I wish there were more caramel sauce - the sauce was only drizzled on top and I think I would like it better if it was incorporated into the froyo when they were making it. 

My friend got vanilla froyo with blueberries, strawberries, and bananas. I didn't taste the banana in it but she was able to. Her combo reminds me of a thicker version of jamba juice and was very refreshing.

I will definitely come back again and try more flavors and maybe bring home a pint of rice pudding.
author: Michelle T.

description:
How can I say no to a cold, sweet treat?! I am the type of person who will eat ice cream/froyo/gelato etc. even if it is the middle of winter. 

I've had Loving Cup on my radar because I wanted a place besides Smitten to do dessert in Hayes Valley. I had the chance to visit during a fire d's birthday outing. Our pub crawl turned into a dessert crawl, which was totally fine by me. We were rolling deep at 10+ people but the staff moved us along quickly. They also lots of little stools and tables so we took over the store for a little while.

I tried the COOKIE MONSTER and MOCHA CHIP froyo combinations. I did not realize they mixed everything up and churned all the toppings together, which is a different method compared to other froyo places. The cookie dough and Oreos were such a good combo in the Cookie Monster. As a coffee lover, I thoroughly enjoyed all the espresso beans that were crushed in Mocha Chip. 

I don't live nearby, but if I did, I would totally take advantage of their stamp card program! I think it's buy 10 get 1 free. Oh well, it's probably better for my waist and wallet to only visit once in awhile. ;)
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
BEST VEGAN FROYO BASE EVER!!!!

Let me start off by saying usually when you read the words "Vegan froyo" or "Vegan ice cream" at a commercial shop it's usually filled with soy milk or fillers that make the option less appealing. I'm not vegan but i'm lactose intolerant and try to follow a mostly paleo lifestyle. Loving Cup's vegan froyo base is just blended frozen bananas (think yonanas). I do this a lot at home and it's fairly simple to make but I don't have toppings to mix in with it or sometimes the time to freeze the bananas. Loving Cup is the perfect option for someone who is trying to get a relatively healthy dessert.

I ordered the Vegan base mixed with nutella and oreos. Frozen bananas blended to resemble the texture of creamy ice cream accentuated with crispy oreo bits and sweetened with nutella. Hands down one of the best healthy dessert options in the Bay Area.
author: Sarah C.

description:
