Did you know Buddha's final meal before his enlightenment was a large bowl of rice pudding? So now you know it wasn't invented by the old woman in the white support hose and black hairnet at your elementary school cafeteria. That was Mrs. Crabtree in mine. Yes, I know she was hot, but remember when she scooped the rice pudding into the dull pink melamine bowl and put a vanilla wafer on top. That was the last time I ate it before the recent wave of rice pudding when Jamie W. and I discovered the first Loving Cup location on Polk where we fell in love with it again.

Now this Loving Cup pops up, and Hayes Valley denizens can bounce between having rice pudding here and bread pudding at Schulzies. Is it fair for one neighborhood to have both? Oh sure, as long as I'm not wolfing it down every day although i was surprised to find out a small cup is only 195 calories. That doesn't seem too decadent. Besides, this one has more seating and seems a bit more relaxed. Yes, I know they offer frozen yogurt, but I never pass up the rice pudding. I can't. Must be in my DNA. There are only six ingredients in their creations: non-fat milk, arborio rice, eggs. sugar, salt and vanilla bean.

I'm rarely there when they have anything beyond their standard selection of Madagascar Vanilla Bean, Cinnamon Rum Raisin or my personal favorite, Coconut. I usually get a Medium cup for $4.75 (photo: http://bit.ly/1G9bpTb). A Small cup is a dollar less and a Large one a dollar more. I was thrilled on one visit to try a special that appealed to my inner child, Mounds with the cup lacquered in milk chocolate and then filled with coconut rice pudding (photo: http://bit.ly/10cR9i8). Sometimes you feel like a nut, sometimes you don't. Just ask Buddha. Or Mrs. Crabtree. Between them, they have all the answers to life.

RICE PUDDING - 4 stars...a satisfying indulgence speaks to my younger self
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...seating available here
SERVICE - 4 stars...fine and dandy
TOTAL - 4 stars..."Please sir, I want some more"
author: Ed U.

description:
YUM. I love this because it's a.) froyo and b.) you can create your own flavor. It's perfect! The quality is fantastic as well and it's not too bad on your wallet. 

Service is friendly but ambience is lacking in so many ways.
author: Katy F.

description:
Heard about this place through a youtuber that I follow and I decided to give this place a try. I'm ashamed of being an SF native because I rarely come to this side of the city. 

Was around the area because bf, brother and I were at OTG Fort Mason, and decided to get dessert here than Frozen Kustard. 

This shop is so minimalistic!! Less is more in my opinion. Their menu was very straight forward and easy to understand what they have to offer. I wasn't much into froyo that night so I decided to give their rice pudding a try! 

All rice pudding are Madagascar vanilla based and then added with their own little twist. So I got the oreo pudding, bf got something that was similar to a butter finger?! And my little brother just had plain choco froyo w/ rainbow sprinkles.

The oreo puddding was sooooo good! But honestly, a little goes a long way. It was really too much for me to finish and I had a size small. You can get sick of it easily. Bf loved his size medium and finished it all! 

Customer service was great. The lady was very patient and accommodating since it was out first time there. They do offer cups of water which you put in a snow cone up!!! Their water dispenser was leaking for the longest time and no one ever bothered to fix it so -1 star for that.

Also, their bathroom didnt have any seat covers.... Hmmm. 

Nonetheless, i'm glad I was able to try something new!
author: Michelle T.

description: I'm a huge froyo fan, but the froyo here didn't taste as tart as typical froyo is. It might be the rice pudding taste, but it tasted like something that couldn't quite figure out if it wanted to be froyo or not.
author: Theodora C.

description: I rushed to make it in 5 min before closing. I was denied service because they were closing soon. Don't waste my time by saying you're open until 9:30 and then stop serving froyo before then. I understand you want to get closed and go home, but you post open hours for a reason. I wouldn't have bothered rushing across the city if I knew you stopped serving froyo before closing.
author: John C.

description:
A hidden gem off a well traveled path in the heart of Hayes Valley. This place seems very overlooked when you've got incredible patisseries, ice cream, coffee and restaurants all around--but give credit where credit is due. Loving Cup is a refreshing (and slightly) healthier alternative to its surrounding dessert options. 

The rice pudding here is pretty spot-on with quite a diverse array of flavors--from simple vanilla to cookies and cream. I had the coconut rice pudding which wasn't too heavy on the coconut but a bit on the sweeter side for me

One of the best things I like about this place is that you get to make your own froyo by combining the different flavors on hand. And they make it right in front of you so it's a pretty cool experience :)

Stop by if you're in the area and enjoy the chill ambience!
author: Jay P.

description: I had the cookies and cream rice pudding here and it was great! It's a lower calorie sweet option that left me wanting more. I had my boyfriend's junior mint ice cream too and loved it.
author: Carolyn T.

description: While I've had Loving Cup many a times before, I had yet to buckle down and get their rice pudding.  I'm a huge fan of their frozen yogurt (the combinations! so many to choose from!), but rice pudding is something I've always been a little so-so on.  That being said, after wandering around in the SF sun this past weekend, I was in the mindframe to try something new.  Rather than stress out over what to get, I went with what looked like the best option to me: the Coconut Rice Pudding was calling my name.  The sweetness of the coconut in the rice pudding reminded me of the Hawaiian dessert haupia, but I couldn't be more surprised in reading their menu board in seeing that a Small rice pudding sets you back only 195 calories and 3.5 grams of fat! Everyone wins in this situation - I will absolutely be back to get more...as if I really needed another reason.
author: Lisa I.

description:
VEGANS: You have an option! Loving Cup's rice pudding all has milk, but the frozen yogurt can be made with a banana-based vegan yogurt (and your choice of added flavors). The banana flavor is strong, so I'd recommend adding a bunch of stuff if you want to cover it up, but the texture is great and it tastes pretty good. 

I was pleasantly surprised to find that the frozen yogurt was made from a base with whatever flavoring (nuts, fruit, chocolate, etc) you could want. I once had something similar in Guatemala, and was excited to find it here. The yogurt did not disappoint; the chocolate base is good and rich, and the selection of toppings is wide and expansive. The yogurt itself is smooth and creamy, but the chocolate chips make it rough, so don't add them if you want it smooth. The menu of suggested combinations is super helpful, and you can always tweak them slightly to your preference.

The price is about average for frozen yogurt, and I would definitely come back if I'm in the area. A great find!
author: Alex J.

description: Favorite froyo! Love the flavors, and how you can create your own froyo mixture. I feel like I am trying something new every time I go. Service is great, very quick, and the people are very friendly.
author: Leslie K.

description:
This place is fantastic. If you're feeling ice cream but something slightly healthier, or maybe a more exciting take on froyo, this is the place to go.

You can choose from a vanilla, chocolate, or I believe banana base (just frozen banana--not sure about this one though), and then you add whatever you want, from frozen berries to chocolate to coconut! Then they throw it all in their nifty machine and out comes a delicious frosty swirl. 

The workers were friendly and the shop was adorable. Definitely a go to!
author: Rachel W.

description: Came on a weekend afternoon and there was no line! Menu is on this huge board behind the counter and can be a little intimidating. I got the dirty hipster as recommended by many people and it was so good! My friend and I sat at the little bar eating our icecream and watched as other people ordered and the workers made their icecream using their froyo machine. Doesn't seem real that it's healthier than icecream, but I'll take it! Portions are good and the icecream isn't so sweet that it makes me parched for a glass of water.
author: Megan K.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to try Loving Cup two weeks ago since we were in the area. Loving Cup is a bit different than other froyo place I've been to, as you pick your base (chocolate or vanilla) and then choose ingredients to mix in. I decided to try a vanilla base froyo with Nutella and cookie dough mixed in, and my boyfriend decided to try the Dirty Hipster, which is a vanilla base froyo with Nutella and Oreos mixed in. Both of our froyos were absolutely delicious. 

I'm a bit of a froyo snob, so I was thoroughly impressed with Loving Cup's concept and execution. Each froyo is hand churned to order, and their ingredients are all natural, probiotic, fat-free and made with live active cultures. Also, according to their website, each 5 oz serving is 120 calories, but I'm sure that depends on your mix ins. 

On our second visit, my boyfriend and I shared a small Oreo rice pudding, which was actually pretty big. Loving Cup's rice pudding is premade, so you have the opportunity to try their flavors before making your purchase. While I didn't care much for the rice pudding, my boyfriend liked it quite a bit.

One thing I really like about Loving Cup is the way they do their customer loyalty cards. After nine purchases, your tenth froyo is free, which isn't too hard to achieve if you come in groups, as Loving Cup gives you credit per order, not per visit, which I really like. 

In regards to their customer service, it's a bit of a hit or miss. The first time we came here, we were greeted kindly by two workers, who were more than willing to tell us exactly how Loving Cup worked and what flavor combinations they thought would work well together. However, the second time we came, we were given somewhat of a cold shoulder by the worker on duty. She seemed to be in a bit of a bad mood, and spent most of her time talking to a customer who seemed to be a friend. She seemed a bit ticked off when we asked for a sample of rice pudding and when we wanted to place our order, as it disrupted her conversation with her friend. Oh well.

Overall, Loving Cup offers quality froyo in a clean and great location. It's also open pretty late, even on Sundays, which I really appreciate since I tend to eat late.
author: Janelle C.

description:
I went in with a group of friends right at 10:30pm last night (12/2). The shop was full of people, although there was a "Closed" sign hanging on the slightly open door. We probably shouldn't have tried to go in (although I'm not sure the first few people in my group noticed the "Closed" sign), however the response from one of the staff members was completely inappropriate. 

There were three staff members working behind the counter. One saw us walk in, looked straight at us, and flipped us off. He then walked to the back of the store and didn't say anything else. I don't think the other employees noticed. Another (much nicer and very polite) employee then told us that the store was closed and apologized that he couldn't serve us.

We could have done a better job heeding the "Closed" sign; I won't be retuning back, though, because of this rude employee.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Omg I love loving cup. It is the greatest place on earth since Eden basically. It's like if you wanted to find the right place to go to spend six hours and eat a hundred pounds of rice pudding and froyo this would be the darn place, on my word. Wow . Especially the girl who prepared my order and made it all by herself. She is so cute I am going to marry her. Will probably come back everyday until she is like you are as passionate about pudding as I am and then that will be my in and I will ask her to marry me. I think her name was Sydney, the cutest brunette with the prettiest eyes. 


I had the cookies and creme pudding yesterday. today I had chocolate chip pudding and a vanilla cinnamon Graham cracker cheesecake kind of froyo. Everything has basically been perfect. I just wish their napkins were higher quality. But that's not enough of a reason to subtract half a star. hopefully I can propose to Sydney before loving cup makes me tubby. 

GUYS: this is the place to take your girl. she will die. First from the pudding / froyo. second from jealousy because Sydney is perfection. but you guys better watch out cuz she is mine for sure.
author: Taj S.

description:
The original Loving Cup in Russian Hill is the only shop in the city that offers rice pudding as a sweet treat. I prayed everyday that one day that the local shop would expand and open more locations. 

And lo and behold, the Loving Cup has indeed opened a second location in Hayes Valley. That gives us more options for your sweet tooth craving. The new location is a bigger venue with more indoor & outdoor dining area than the Russian Hill location. The spacious area is a must in Hayes Valley, because Hayes Valley is a family-friendly neighborhood for locals and outsiders. 

On my debut of the new location, I ordered the medium Cookie and Cream rice pudding for $4.75. Sweet and creamy with chunks of Oreo cookies makes this treat sinful. You can mix and match any of the available flavored rice pudding. My treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/loving-cup-san-francisco-4?select=KWV2CuOcAEn1EVeevwWbgg#JjAyQHfielMCtvOKO4bV8g

Some of the kids patronizing there may consider it a peevish annoyance and was not born then. But as I was enjoying my sweet treat, the shop was blasting 80's heavy metal rock. That was my era of music I still enjoyed listening to occasionally. My treat tasted a lot better. "Now where is my Fender Guitar?"

The shop also offer frozen yogurt and other baked goods. I will come here for dessert after dining around the area.
author: Matt G.

description: Imagine Coldstone and Pinkberry had a baby, yea that's Loving Cup! Whipped frozen yoghurt with toppings!! I've had the rice pudding here as well, but the mixed froyo is the star!! I can't wait to come back again and try the rest of their combos!!
author: Shruti S.

description:
I like to tell myself that froyo is a healthier alternative to ice cream. Whether or not this is true is of no concern to me.

Medium Dirty Hipster (5.50) - Vanilla froyo w/ nutella & oreos. This tasted like cookies and cream and was absolutely delicious! I love how the cookies are perfectly blended into the froyo, and it wasn't too sweet. I definitely recommend sharing this was someone. Just bc you can finish it by yourself doesn't mean you should.  

I'll definitely be back!
author: Lucy N.

description:
Blended froyo, a wall full of Nutella, and a great loyalty card program. I'm a fan of Loving Cup (some aren't *ahem* ahaefner).

The biggest problem I have here is figuring out what to order. There are a lot of choices for mixins and they do make it easier by having a menu with some pre-fabbed combinations (thin mint is one of my favorites: andes mints + Oreos) BUT I always try to find something novel to order. This means you'll likely end up interacting awkwardly with the person at the register while he/she waits on your order; be prepared!
author: Andrew C.

description:
I really dig this place. I was craving ice cream on a Monday afternoon and having seen this place for a long, long time, I finally got the chance to try it. It's basically a dessert place that sells rice pudding and froyo options. I know what you're thinking: ah yes another froyo place. FALSE. This froyo is actually pretty different. They have two flavors: vanilla or chocolate, and then you basically blend a topping into the froyo.  It's not like the Coldstone or DQ concept where it's added in with the ice cream and then mixed. When you get the actual cup of froyo, it looks as if the froyo basically dispensed the toppings with it. Sounds kind of weird but is a simple and well executed concept. I just really like having my toppings with my actual ice cream.

I got the vanilla with graham crackers and gummy bears. Good froyo with good toppings, what's to complain? If you're too lazy to create your own, they also have pre-created ones that you can just order from. You can also sample the rice pudding--I've never had rice pudding before so I tried the cookies and cream one which was pretty good given the fact that it is rice pudding. 

They also have pretty ample seating which is really nice if you're in the area and just want to catch up with a friend or take a break from your exploring and wandering. 

tldr; rice pudding and froyo--froyo has the toppings pre-mixed . good stuff.
author: Jasmine X.

description: Loving Cup has a super cute, inviting storefront. Its minimalistic decor parallels its 'minimalistic' service. I ordered the Thin Mint, which could have & should have been blended twice. My brother, a frequent customer here, says they normally blend twice. Parts of my froyo had none of the mixed junior mints nor oreos-just plain vanilla. Regardless, it still tasted very yummy. However, the workers there were completely absorbed in their own entertainment. Perhaps it was just the off-chance that their friend was visiting, but the two servers were loud and a bit distracting while chatting him up. There was no follow-up with customer service after you'd finished ordering. They yell out the froyo flavor and you pick it up. I wish there was more worker-customer engagement to encourage a community environment. Wasn't really fun to sit/ stay for a bit due to the obnoxious workers.
author: Bridget H.

description:
I think I went to Loving Cup 4 times this past week.  This place is super cute and fits in with the rest of the "Hayes Valley feel".

My favorite mix ins are: vanilla with junior mint or frosted animal crackers.  You can also get a stamp card too!
author: Candace C.

description: i got a giftcard for loving cup. i'm a vegan so i got the "faux-yo" which is basically just frozen banana (not mentioned on their menu). the banana is fairly overwhelming so you can't taste the other toppings well, but what i do like about this dessert is that it's very healthy! downside is it's expensive for just banana. first toppings we got were the salty dog, couldn't taste much but the caramel on top. second was "faux-yo" with strawberry, mango, and coconut chips. very mild flavor. i was happy it was a gift card because it's a healthy treat but i'm not sure when i'd go back and pay for this on my own.
author: Elise H.

description:
This place can be renamed a bunch of different things, but I think Addicting Cup would be a fitting description.

I've stopped by here several times with my friends when we want to share a light dessert, and each time has been nothing short of delightful. 

The concept behind the Loving Cup? 
1) Choose a base, either vanilla or chocolate, of frozen yogurt.
2) Mix in absolutely everything your heart desires.

I typically blend in a lot of fruits, but you can go wild with graham crackers, cookie dough, and even gummy bears! You're not just getting toppings slapped on--you're getting them WITH the frozen yogurt. And that in itself is amazing. You can make this treat as light or as decadent as you want, and there's no wrong time to stop by and devour it in minutes/seconds.

My favorite combos:
1) Blueberries, raspberries, granola, and almond butter (vanilla base--it tastes like breakfast!)
2) Coconut, pineapple, and mango (vanilla base)
3) Espresso and toffee (chocolate base)

But really, you can't go wrong. Try as many combinations as possible!

The rice pudding is just as divine. My favorite flavors are the chocolate rum raisin (sorry not sorry if you don't like raisins, but this might just change your mind), espresso, and chai spice. Getting the latter two with steamed milk turns it into a warm treat, and adding a shot of espresso to either the rum raisin or chai spice gives a great cinnamon-mocha flavor. I could also just be addicted to all things coffee.

I dare you not to order a huge tub of the rice pudding. It's addicting. This whole store is, and I'm fine with giving it a 6/5 and ranking it as one of my favorite dessert places.
author: Kat P.

description:
I LOVE LOVING CUP! Enough said.

Even better cause now they have a location in Hayes Valley!!!! Which I frequently visit.
It was my first time trying this location. I literally squealed when I walked by and ran in excited to have the BF try it. The other location is on Polk Street and it's harder to find parking there IMO.

I always get their frozen yogurt. You can put whatever toppings and however many toppings you want in it. I love their large selection of fresh fruit and other toppings. Some of my favorite combinations include vanilla base+strawberry+nutella, chocolate base+peanut butter+bananas, and vanilla base+nutella+bananas. I love the versatility and creativity you can play around with. They also have this AMAZING machine that mixes everything together. I always enjoy watching them make my order.

They also have rice pudding which I've never tried.

I also learned today that they have a frequent visitor stamp card. The worker was very nice and stamped a few extra since I mentioned I never got a stamp card before, but apparently they've always had it. They also stopped charging a fee with credit card, AWESOMEEE.

Great price for the amount you get.

Yippie for another Loving Cup location!!!! :D
author: Stephanie L.

description: Really disappointed with this location. I love the new location in the Marina District, but this one is horrible in comparison. The yogurt is good, but everything about the employees is just awful. I ordered my usual and it had a huge hole. Like literally 1/2 the amount of yogurt it should, while my friends was fully filled. I worked in the yogurt industry when I was a teen, so I know how it should be, plus I wasn't a new customer to Loving Cup. Anyway, I asked a gentleman working after Karen made my order if it was always that hole-y. He said yes that's proper technique (uhh since when??) and then I showed my friends yogurt to him and said hers was full and he just shrugged and said okkkkk??? Horrible customer service skills!! Will NOT return to the Octavia location, total rip off.
author: Jacquelyne Z.

description:
Loving Cup, I must apologize for underestimating you. I'm not a fan of frozen yogurt in general and walked in to your store with the lowest of expectations. 

I was surprised to see something completely unique that I have not seen anywhere else... a variety of specialty flavored rice puddings that turned out to be absolutely delicious. They even offer you tastes of each before you decide as if you were in an ice cream store.

I had a taste of the cookies and cream as well as the lemon vanilla and both were very good. I ended up going with the cinnamon rum raisin though and it was fantastic. 

I will definitely be returning here and maybe next time I will even get a little crazy and add a topping on it. I doubt I will ever order frozen yogurt from them, but this place definitely gets my approval.
author: Mark O.

description:
So much yum! I've only been here once (though I would like to keep coming back again and again) but I ordered the chocolate frozen yogurt with the espresso mix in. It was delicious and creamy and so tasty! Since it was my first time, I didn't want to try one of their creations, but I will be back to try one of them.

The concept is so interesting because why can't there be a coldstone for fro-yo?

It's open pretty late so come by after dinner in Hayes Valley, you won't regret it!
author: Malika R.

description: Banana base is delicious, has a great texture and tastes great with basically anything! Service was phenomenal.
author: Camilo O.

description: ya know I gotta be honest. I just go pretty basic here. basic but good. I got their vanilla rice pudding today and it was fabulous. it is so creamy and sweet. luckily like some other rice puddings the rice is not too chewy. in fact, it is not chewy at all. it is just right. the texture is almost like custard. very creamy, and yet, smooth. perfect as I would call it. just perfect.
author: Ford W.

description:
Loving Cup made me a happy camper to say the least. My boyfriend and I have been waiting to try this place for quite awhile. And once we took on the opportunity, we were not disappointed. I always mistaken Loving Cup for ice cream, but it's actually frozen yogurt! It's a cute, old-fashioned spot in Hayes Valley. They like to commend themselves for being all-natural, made with probiotics, and guilt-free. I love the customizable flavors and the wide range of concoctions you can pick from! I got the vanilla based froyo with oreos and raspberries. What's neat about this place is that they blend them all together and on the spot. Made fresh and ready to devour :)

Quite on the pricey side (nothing like Yogurtland prices). As much as I can eat this on a daily basis, my wallet won't let me. The first flavor is free but additional add-ons cost an extra 75 cents. Ouch!
author: Jackie T.

description:
Why do I feel like I'm the only one who didn't like my yogurt? I had high hopes for this place...the reviews were really good. On top of that...the pics on Yelp & Instagram were captivating. Sadly...this wasn't the case with my order.

I love the setting of this place. Very modern yet has a youthful bakery/cafe feel to it. Also, there were plenty of seats. The menu was on a board and you could customize your cup of froyo as you please.

I ordered the Vanilla Yogurt Base w/ Bananas and Oreos. I was excited. I waited a good 15-20 for my order to be made. Although it took long...I liked how everything was made to order. Visually...my medium cup of froyo looked great. As for the taste...it's a different story.

I couldn't taste the vanilla in the yogurt. Tasted like frozen milk...2% not whole milk. Then the crumbles of oreos were obviously swimming all throughout the yogurt but it was barely detectable in taste. All I could taste was the subtle sweetness of the banana. I don't know if I ordered the wrong thing or it's normally like this.

I was disappointed. If I'm in the area I'd give them another try to see if other flavors would prove better than the one I ordered. Parking was difficult and the line took long. The only positive thing about my visit was the "Churros" Rice Crispies Bar (one of the individuals waiting in line offered to give me a small piece.)  It tasted like an Horchata Rice Crispies Bar...so good!
author: Ralph N.

description:
My love for the Loving Cup started as a mistake: I walked in thinking it was a coffee shop. I quickly learned that they don't serve coffee (at least, not yet), but they DO serve the most delicious blends of frozen yogurt with a plentiful variety of toppings. And rice pudding. Several kinds.

So I left, found coffee, came back that night with my husband. We stuck to Yelpers' advice and tried the Dirty Hippie and the Salty Dog - we were NOT disappointed. Because I also read about the samples, I tried (and then ordered) a small Rum Raisin Rice Pudding in addition. "I will save it for breakfast," I told myself. "It has milk and raisins, it's practically cereal."  The rice pudding did not survive the walk home. My only regret is wasting a to-go lid.

Can't wait to go back and try more toppings and combos. Chocolate with junior mints and oreos? Almond butter with bananas? I'll take them all. Plus I am already one-third of the way to a free cup on my punch card!

Note: I saw some other reviews about poor service, but I am happy to report that all three employees I encountered today (on my accidental visit and my later re-visit) were awesome - cheery, helpful, and rockin' a sweet playlist in the shop.
author: Catie F.

description: Waited in a (shortish) line in the middle of the day but they were so insultingly understaffed I walked away after five minutes when the line didn't move at all. Have some respect for your customers who Are willing to Give you their time and $$$ for your high priced goods--and have enough staff/registers to accommodate.
author: alex v.

description: nice location in hayes valley neighborhood :) they do collect stamp for reward!
author: Freya-Loki O.

description:
This is definitely one of my favorite places in San Francisco to get my sweet tooth on. I love that it's in Hayes Valley which isn't too far to get to by car from my neighborhood. 
I always ALWAYS order the Dirty Hipster. How can one deter away from the most delicious combination of nutella and oreos? And most recently, I created the Dirtier Hipster, which is Dirty Hipster + pretzels. ORDER IT, you'll thank me.
author: Amy X.

description:
Not my kind of frozen yogurt place. only because it is too sweet for my taste. If you love sweet sweet then this is perfect for you. It also melted too fast for me. it becomes a soupy mess and unpleasant to eat. 

I got the vanilla base and added chocolate chips and marshmallow. I didn't like the taste of the chocolate chips. 

service was fine. but it is pretty empty at weekday 6pm and it wasn't hot out. It was a windy chilly day. I doubt I would come back.
author: Jules L.

description:
While I was waiting for a friend to get off work for drinks, I decided to wander around a bit and explore this neighborhood as it was my first time in the area and stumbled across Loving Cup. And being in the appetite for something sweet, I decided to check this place out. And I'm sure glad that I did.

They had a ton of options to cover your sweet and cold cravings and even though it was chilly outside, there was still a line inside to get a taste of their delicious desserts.

I decided to get the medium peanut butter Oreo cup and it was just perfect.

There're seats inside and a couple of tables outside but the inside was clean and bright. Loved their minimalistic approach to designing the store and had that very much modern kitchen look and feel with white subway tiles and hanging pendant lighting. The noise level is medium so quiet enough to hold a normal conversation but loud enough not to hear your next door neighbor.

If you're in the area, check this place out for your after-meal sweets.

Price: $5+
Wait: 5-10 mins after ordering
author: Pourio L.

description: Loved Loving Cup (pun intended) in Russian Hill -- was delightfully surprised they have a Hayes Valley location. This place's frozen yogurt definitely puts a spin on the now run-of-the-mill soft serve style (a la Pink Berry) in that it has a firmer texture and almost tastes like it's ice cream. My favorite is to keep it tart with blue berries and mango.
author: Thomas C.

description: Love this little froyo shop! It is set in a cute neighborhood, so it makes for a perfect stop while you're exploring San Fran. I got a mixture of peanut butter and chocolate. The employee even coated of the bottom of the cup in chocolate to make for the perfect mixture. Tons of house made concoctions to choose from, or you can customize your flavors (as I did). Wish we had a location in Florida!
author: Nina M.

description: Can't say that the froyo necessarily knocked my socks off, but it's somewhat cheaper than the gourmet ice cream that SF is selling elsewhere.  I just had some vanilla froyo with mango mixed in.  It was just frozen mango I think.  The froyo itself didn't have much taste to me, but it was entertaining to watch the machine that mixed it all together.  It was pretty busy when I went so there was quite a long wait.  Would've been helpful if there were 3 workers instead of 2 or if they had been more organized.  It's pretty cool that they have a bunch of flavor combinations here.  I'd probably want to come back to try the rice pudding though.
author: Bryson L.

description:
I came here after having finished Smitten's ice cream and wanted to try more sweets... haha I swear, everything in the Bay is sweet and savory... many dessert places just around the corner, and many yummy restaurants. I looked on Yelp for dessert places and came across Loving Cup.. actually, someone was walking by my bench as I was eating my smittens hahaha I came here for the Rice Pudding.. I remember having "Rice to Riches" in NYC and thought I'd give this place a try.

Environment - a nicely sized shop. As you walk in there's the counter with a glass display filled with rice pudding and other non-important items hehe. Very clean and there are two long tables to the front of either size of the shop.

Service - the workers are very willing to let you try the rice pudding. When i was there, there was a girl who was looking for another item but they didn't have it.. so they had her try the rice pudding even though she was leaving anways. Good service!

Food - Rice pudding.. this was the only thing I tried. I am going to compare this to Rice to Riches in NYC... sorry. It's not as thick as I would've liked or rich. But I do believe that it is yummy anyways. There were 6 flavors to choose room.. coconut raisin, cookies and cream, lemon vanilla, vanilla bean, and other flavors I have forgotten. I think that all of them tasted very good but I went for the vanilla bean.. sort of original and reminds me of tapioca.

They also sell hand-churned frozen yogurt haha I just didn't have any.

I wound recommend you you coming here if you're on a date and wanting rice pudding haha it's a nice environement to chit chat and nice workers to be around.
author: Connie V.

description:
Loving cup is such a cool concept (haha, see what I did there? since it's fro-yo and fro-yo is cold? ok let's move on.) 

Much better than basic froyo with mix-ins, since they do some magic and mix it in for you! It reminds me of cold stones, but cooler and not as heavy. 

I got the vanilla base with espresso, strawberries, and raspberries. It tasted like coffee heaven with spurts of berry. Drooling now, must go to SF soon.
author: Shelley K.

description:
Cute little place in Hayes Valley. They have a lot of options--including rice pudding and yogurt. (They even a yogurt special called Brian Boitano!) 

Clean, good service, and convenient place to grab yogurt and go.
author: Yanni L.

description: I don't understand the good reviews. I took two bites and threw mine out. Truly, I might as well have thrown away $5 instead. The vanilla is icy and completely tasteless. The ice cream place around the corner had a line, this place was empty. No wonder.
author: Nancy R.

description: I'm hooked on loving cup, my new favorite fro-yo place in SF. Non-fat, probiotic, all natural ingredients and that's exactly what you get! I stopped by twice in two days because I loved it so much. I like the combinations they have, I went with the Cookie Monster (vanilla + oreo + cookie dough) and I was not disappointed. Some other flavors I tried out were just as good - Dirty Hipster (vanilla + nutella + oreo) and Banana Bread (vanilla + banana + walnut + cinnamon). Can't wait to go back!!
author: Elaine N.

description: Ever since I tasted Rices to Riches a few years back during a trip in NY, I developed quite the affinity for rice pudding - it's pretty much my go-to dessert! I've been looking for comparable pudding, and oftentimes find myself at Loving Cup. It isn't bad but wish they offered more flavors than the usual 4 (vanilla or Madagascar bean, rum raisin , coconut, and one more I believe).
author: Alison H.

description:
Went to the other location the other day and was stunned by the amazing customer service and rice puddings. Therefore I just couldn't help myself but try this location since we were walking through.

There was only one girl working the counter and she wasn't knowledgeable of the pudding flavors. I have a gluten allergy so asking if the samples had gluten and given an uncertain answer was frustrating. She didn't know if rice contained gluten.

The 2 I sampled were the vanilla and the lemon vanilla. Both tasted exactly the same ... no difference. Was a little disappointed but I do confirm that the coconut is worth the drive still!
author: Carlin T.

description:
This is not an ordinary frozen yogurt shop. My younger brother "hates" froyo and changed his mind after I brought him here. The Loving Cup has two base yogurt flavors and then crushes the ingredients into the yogurt and it makes for an extremely delicious treat. You can choose your own ingredients or pick from their list of creations. I highly recommend trying them- My favorite is the Salty Dog. 

They also have rice pudding that I've been meaning to try, just can't pass up on the froyo each time I go!
author: Caroline L.

description: DIRTY HIPSTER!!!!! Best froyo I've had in my entire life. Wow wow wow wowwwww. They mix the Nutella with the Oreo to perfection so it's not crunchy. I love it so much. What a dream place lol
author: Grace L.

description:
Hands down my favorite frozen treat in the Bay Area!! It is creamier and more rich than frozen yogurt places like fraiche, but not as rich as places like smitten. 

Location-  this is my favorite because it isn't as busy and there is a lot more space to sit down and enjoy your yummy treat. Oh, there is free wifi and outdoor seating, so perfect if you have a dog! 

The frozen yogurt- SO GOOD. Think of a more sophisticated cold stone by slightly healthier. They have this machine that they designed just for there frozen yogurt that looks like a drill that churns your yummy mix. You start with your nonfat frozen yogurt base(chocolate or vanilla) then you can choose your additions(anything from fruit to more decadent options like candies and cookies). If you don't want to make your own, they have various flavor combinations that are actually slightly cheaper than making your own(if you are adding more than 3 things). I usually keep it simple with strawberries and vanilla and my boyfriend usually gets blueberries, espresso, and vanilla(you should try this, it is delicious!). So I hate to admit this, but we have totally ordered 4 for just the two of us on multiple occasions because it is just that good! 

They have rice pudding too and it is really good as well but I just love their frozen yogurt so much so I always get that instead. The rice pudding is a great texture and just the right amount of sweet plus there are about 6 different flavors:) 

COME HERE AND ENJOY, you won't be disappointed!
author: Jenny T.

description:
Hi, my name is Sara and I'm a Loving Cup addict. 

Rice pudding and froyo?!? I'm not sure you've ever had a craving for rice pudding, but I have. Thankfully, Loving cup makes ALL kinds to satisfy any and every craving you could ever have. They rotate their flavors, but I've tried: Lemon Vanilla, Bittersweet Chocolate Chip, & Cinnamon. They also have Cookies n Cream, and Rum Raisin quite frequently. It's so creamy and sinfully delicious. They're all good! I know my body is paying for it but I just can't help myself. A small will run you $3.75, a medium $4.75, large $5.75 and they are quite hefty. 

I personally have never ordered froyo, but I've always sampled OTHER people's orders. The Dirty Hipster is definitely a winner. I love watching them make it in their newfangled contraption.

Loving Cup is a delicious treat and I acknowledge my addiction. I will continue to feed it.
author: Sara S.

description:
First time coming here and I'm addicted!! 

Froyo tasted creamy and was made just right with the perfect amount of toppings. I picked up "The Dude Abides" and boy, the toffee nuts mixed with the almond butter and chocolate froyo was to die for. Definitely recommended for anybody in the area! 

Smittens is just down the block but this spot is definitely worth your time as well! Pick up some froyo from this place and slide on over to a bench at the nearby park. The cool hipsters are always out and about so if you're a foodie, be sure to ask around at the park for more hidden gems in the neighborhood!
author: Kaye S.

description: Cute, quirky place with tasty mix-ins for frozen yogurt PLUS many flavored of rice pudding. Is this a THING? It should be!
author: Marie D.

description:
Loving Cup is like a make-your-own McFlurry where you choose the base and the toppings/mixins.  The selection of mixins is awesome...everything from fruit, nuts, gummi bears, waffle cone, chocolate ganache, etc.  They've invented this ridiculously unique giant drill that literally drills through your froyo or rice pudding up and down until it mixes up everything to your liking.

We ordered a medium vanilla frozen yogurt with salted caramel, waffle cone, and ganache.  It was marvelous.  I think we probably could have done without the ganache though since you have to add 75 cents for each additional topping...so it can get a little pricey.  Nutella is also an awesome go-to mixin.  

I will have to try the rice pudding next time but I just wasn't feeling that adventurous just quite yet.
author: Jess Y.

description:
I thought I was over the froyo scene until a friend took me to Loving Cup after dinner one time. Dude, let me tell ya--this place has me loving froyo again. At least, just their froyo.

I love the fact that their toppings are blended into the yogurt base itself. And the froyo definitely doesn't taste like froyo--seriously, it feels like you're eating ice cream! For a small size, the portions are rather generous. And I love the little swirly thing they do to it, ha. My go-to is the cookie monster--I don't know what it is about their cookie dough that makes it so damn good.

I'll have to come back and try the rice pudding next time. It's been on my radar, but I just can't pull myself away from that froyo. Yumz.

If you're in Hayes Valley and you're looking for something other than Smitten (because that place is *so* last year), stop by here. You won't regret it!
author: Bettina P.

description:
RICE PUDDING! Why don't more places serve this wonderful dessert?  

The Cinnamon Rum Raisin is my top pic.

And the froyo ain't bad either.
author: Shannon H.

description: Super unique and delicious. I get the Dirty Hipster and add peanut butter. Can be a bit of a wait at times but that mixing machine can only go so fast. Haven't tried the rice pudding yet, but I've meaning to.
author: Ross R.

description: LOVE this place, it is so fun to create your own flavor, I have yet to be disappointed!
author: Briane S.

description: Beware: The vegan "froyo" here is made out of bananas and will not taste good with all topping!!! I had an overall bad experience here. I went to Loving Cup on a Saturday night, and there was only one employee running the shop. The line went out the door, and the employee running the shop moved at a glacial speed and took at least ten peoples' orders after me before preparing my order. I waited for over 20 minutes, and once he began preparing my order, it took less than 30 seconds. The worst part was that I had ordered the "Thin Mint" with the vegan froyo (because I'm lactose intolerant) not knowing that it was banana based because this is nowhere on the menu, and the employee did not tell me this. (You'd think he'd say something, because banana and mint are not a good combination.) Needless to say, it was inedible!!! I ended up not eating it, and I didn't think it was worth waiting for a new order. I will not be returning to Loving Cup.
author: Megan A.

description: I've been to the other location in Russian Hill before and decided to try this one and I loved it! I like this location better because it's bigger and has more seatings. The shop itself is very cute. There weren't that many people when I went so it was relatively quiet and had lots of room. The froyo was very good as usuaI! (I ordered blueberry and mango on vanilla.) I will definitely come back to this location again!
author: Erika S.

description:
I'm a huge fan of the Loving Cup in Russian Hill. The frozen yogurt is the most REFRESHING dessert I've had. I was excited to see that there was one in Hayes Valley too. This location looks very similar but has more room - clean, spacious indoor with long tables and some outdoor seating. It's a great place to meet with friends or even get some work/studying in like me (although it can get pretty loud in there sometimes). I thought service was very quick and friendly. There was no line and plenty of seating when I visited Sunday afternoon.

I ordered a medium vanilla frozen yogurt with strawberries and mango blended in (~$6). It's not too sweet and has the PERFECT consistency. You can mix in all sorts of other ingredients but that is my favorite combo so far.

The prices are on the more expensive side for a yogurt place but I think the higher quality is very worth it. I love this place and will definitely be back again.
author: Linda X.

description:
Freshly mixed froyo. Loved the strawberry + Oreo combo. They use fresh strawberries, rather than artificial flavoring. 

My friend got the Dirty Hipster (Nutella + Oreo), which was good, too. 

Rice pudding is also quite delightful, but a bit heavy if you have the whole cup, in my opinion. 

Friendly staff. A bit pricey but worth the splurge once in a while!
author: Michelle K.

description: Add this place to my "Reasons Why I Love Hayes Valley" list. It had been in my bookmarks list for well over a year, and I finally had time--and space in my stomach--to try it out. We ordered the cookies 'n cream rice pudding, and my husband and I were pleasantly surprised all around. I wouldn't normally call myself a fan of rice pudding, but I would come back to try their take on it. And if it isn't your favorite, they have froyo choices as well.
author: Kelly S.

description:
I'm a big cookie dough fan so I had to get a small vanilla and cookie dough frozen yogurt. It was so creamy and good. Could taste well the little mini pieces of cookie.
You can get as many toppings mixed in as you want. Small is a good size for an afternoon snack or light dessert. 
My husband got the peanut butter cup and tasted well the peanut butter.
Not many people in middle of afternoon, we did not have to wait a minute! Will return ASAP, prob for same flavor and why not add Nutella or pecans too. :-D
author: Leslie S.

description: This is by far my favorite ice cream/frozen yogurt place. The best part is lactose intolerant people can have it! Everyone has to try it!
author: Samira A.

description: YUM! This place can get pretty packed but it does give you time to look at their extensive menu to choose what you want. First you choose the base of your frozen yogurt, either non-fat vanilla or chocolate. Then you pick the toppings you want to add into your frozen yogurt mixture. Toppings are 75 cents each. I ordered a vanilla based yogurt with oreos and nutella and it was delicious! They have a customized machine that blends the yogurt and toppings together (reminds me of cold stone but a machine version instead). It is interesting to see the machine at work. They also serve different flavors of rice pudding which I will have to go back to try. Loving Cup is not cheap, but a good option when you have a sweet tooth.
author: Crystal M.

description: Yummy, yes. But it's a bit too fusion for me. Rice pudding in a variety of flavors are available at any Chinese or Vietnamese supermarket and for less than half the price. I did like the clean store and the customer service.
author: Will H.

description:
This place is so good!! 

I got the Salty Dog (vanilla froyo w/ pretzel bits & caramel sauce) and it wasn't too sweet/ just right. Their serving sizes are also very big, I got a medium cup because I got excited to try the place and I couldn't finish it because the portion was HUGE. A small would've been perfect. I also got to sample the rice pudding and it was delicious ! Definitely will be coming back.
author: Nancy C.

description: This is one of Hayes Valley's hole in the wall frozen yogurt place! It was a bit difficult to find this place and let alone find street parking, but it was well worth the struggle. I've never been to a place that blends your frozen yogurt + toppings together to make it into one whole frozen yogurt. I do like that this place is fresh and makes their yogurt with organic, nonfat, and healthy ingredients! I was stumped on what I wanted in my frozen yogurt so I selected something from their pre made menu. I ordered the cookie monster without the Oreos( I am not a huge fan of Oreos) and my friend ordered the strawberry frozen yogurt with animal crackers. She liked it, but I LOVED my cookie monster yogurt! You can taste the freshness in the yogurt and the milk. The cookie dough topped it for me. I would definitely recommend people to come give this place a try if they are in the area. I know for sure I will be back to customize my own frozen yogurt! I should note that they also sell rice pudding, but I did not get to try it.
author: Danika P.

description:
Rice pudding of many flavors (ever try bittersweet chocolate chip rice pudding?), blended froyo with over 20 different toppings, what more can you ask for in a post-meal dessert? 

I have to say I was thrilled to know this place opened up in Hayes Valley. I didn't have to go all the way to Polk Street to get my fix. A little sad though that it ended up replacing a former tea house that was a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city. Despite this, I found the Loving Cup takeover a refreshing and suitable addition to this charming little district. It's a stone throw away from many eateries (i.e. Patxi's, Le Boulange, Stacks, etc.), which I think works to its advantage as people tend to balance out their palates with something sweet, but not incredibly indulgent or guilt-inducing. There are plenty of tables and chairs. Every time that I've been here, I've never had trouble getting a table for myself. It's very spacious! I even noticed one girl taking a whole table for herself with her study materials spread out. The employees are very friendly and helpful in narrowing down the choices for me. Overall, I've had nothing but wonderful experiences the two times I've been here. 

For the price of a cup of coffee, the froyo mixed with fruit (1 mix-in included) can make you feel very healthy. I personally enjoy tasting a flavorful combination, so vanilla & raspberry was a perfect mix. Just be wary that the seeds could get wedged between your molars. They have a list of popular combinations with clever names attached to them (i.e. Have you done your homework, Larry?), Most are pretty common combinations, including strawberries & graham crackers. I have yet to choose from the menu because I've always had a craving for fruit, which I would prefer alone. But whatever your preference, the sky's the limit as to what you can put together. 

Let's not forget about the rice pudding. I love love love the cookies and cream rice pudding. You can really taste the chunks of Oreos in almost every bite. YUM! I think the bittersweet chocolate chip was just okay. It was bland to me probably because I wasn't able to taste the chocolate. I have yet to try the other flavors. Cannot wait for my next visit!
author: Brittany D.

description: Went here on a wednesday afternoon and it was pretty empty. I got the cookies n cream rice pudding and vanilla yogurt blended with english toffee and strawberries. Both were amazing. I loved the texture and taste of both, it wasn't too sweet but still had enough flavor. Price isn't too shabby either and it's non fat so if you're watching your calorie intake, it's only 120 calories for a small serving of the yogurt and 195 calories for the rice pudding!
author: Celine C.

description:
Yum! First time having rice pudding and I loved the cookies & cream flavor. It was the perfect dessert to have on a cold day. I thought the price was really good too for the amount that I got. Service was also friendly and patient with me. Since it was my first time trying the pudding, I wanted to sample a bunch of the flavors and they were nice + accommodating. 

We also ordered a pineapple smoothie, which had a juicy/more liquidy texture. They use fresh fruit, which is nice. However it's a bit pricier and I'm not sure I would order it again. I would definitely come back for their yogurt and rice pudding though!
author: Sophia H.

description: Really cute place w/ really good frozen yogurt and not too expensive. I ordered what I think is called the "salty dog," vanilla fro-yo w/ pretzels and homemade salted caramel. Really good! Had a bite of the strawberry shortcake. Vanilla fro-yo w/ animal cookies... Not my favorite but my friend like it
author: Andreea M.

description: This place is my favorite frozen yogurt place in SF.  It's doesn't compare to anywhere else.  You can make your own flavored frozen yogurt.  Plus, all the ingredients are natural and taste so good.  This is my go-to dessert place and I love it!
author: Ghazal S.

description: No accountability whatsoever. Drink order not monitored. Had to wait 20 mins, when after 15 mins it was discovered never placed but wouldn't refund money. Disgustingly hot as well. Drink eventually arrived flavorless and not cold.
author: MartyMar G.

description: Loving Cup is my favorite late night treat!  I like every flavor I've tried, especially the salty dog. Only complaints are that the wait can take forever if there's a long line because they mix each individual fro-yo, and they close way too early! (9:30 PM on weeknights)
author: A C.

description: It was my first time trying this place and I chose to try the homemade coconut rice pudding.  Delicious and a must try for any fans of tapioca pudding!  Next time I will try getting the frozen yogurt as they make it right in front of you.
author: Richard L.

description:
The yogurt is okay here, but watch out for them to "mix in" things you didn't ask for. 

This is a place where you order frozen yogurt and any mix-ins you want. The problem was that I ordered chocolate yogurt with salted caramel. That's all. I didn't order any coconut to be mixed in to my chocolate yogurt with salted caramel. But there was a bunch of coconut in it. And I don't like coconut. I didn't ask for coconut. Perhaps there was coconut on the mixing equipment from the yogurt order of the person who went before me. But I didn't want his coconut in my yogurt. 

Next time I will go to Bi-rite to get ice cream with no mix-ins (like I really wanted to before we decided to try this place for the first time). I don't think I will go back.
author: Beatrice C.

description:
This is one of the better Frozen Yogurt spots I've been to. Why? There aren't an insane amount of kids running around. I'm serious! Have you ever been to Fro-yo and seen the kids standing under the self serve machines with their mouth on the spout? Parents watching but not doing anything? It's disturbing.

This spot is NOT self serve. The yogurt is definitely of higher quality than those franchise pop-up shops you've been to. They mix in your flavors/toppings/choices for you and it is done perfectly. I can recommend Cookies and Cream, Salted Caramel, PB Cup.... I should stop there :) 

There is also Rice Pudding. I don't have rice pudding often but when I do- its from here. Rum Raisin was fantastic!
author: Karen A.

description:
I love the thick, creamy texture of this non-fat frozen yogurt! Sure, the toppings aren't fat-free,  but at least we all start from zero :) 

I had chocolate with salted caramel and cookie dough. I think next time I want Nutella and coconut mixed with chocolate. Oooh ohhhh :D
author: Jacquee P.

description:
Loving Cup still has rice pudding but it's changed the way they do froyo. now one can customize what's in the froyo:
-choose either a vanilla or chocolate base (patty comes frozen)
-add toppings, 
-froyo and add-ins are churned ala yogen fruz.but with dry yogurt not wet.
-result is caught in a cup and served..

eats: english toffee with expresso mix-in with vanilla froyo (5.50m)
-vanilla tasted rich, add-ins ok
-not much of a fan of this froyo version

frodrips:
-over 50 add-ins possible, first free, rest .75 cents each.
-if the mood strikes, may try it again.......
3.5 stars.
author: Victor G.

description:
Let's just say there are better things to love than frozen yogurt and rice pudding here. Im not sure the name of the person who helped us but she was a ray of light! Her sweet attitude more than made for the lack of sugar in the rice pudding. Maybe she unknowingly absorbed it all? 

We've since been back and while our ray of light wasn't there, neither was the sugar. So far we've had the coconut, lemon and Madagascar vanilla, each one lacked much sweetness. For some this might be alright but for me it's not what rice pudding is all about. Rice pudding is supposed to be comforting but here it was more like a pizza with no cheese, Thai food without chili, spaghetti with no meatballs, you get the idea. The texture and the flavors were there, so kudos for those, but dang check the amount of sugar in the recipe. 

The frozen yogurt was pretty good and a nice alternative to the long lines down the street at the other dessert place. It's probably healthier here too, even with some of the fun mix ins LC offers. Oh, there's lots of seating here too, so take a load of and stay a while.
author: Alexander C.

description:
So far I've tried the dirty hipster (vanilla with nutella and oreo), pineapple coconut, and cookie dough)

The dirty hipster was good.
The pineapple coconut was also refreshing but I wished that it said it was coconut shavings instead of just coconut because I am a fan of coconut but so much of the shavings.  I didn't like having that shaving texture all over my fro-yo.  The cookie dough was good as well.

I tried the English toffee rice pudding and it was good but my all time favorite place for rice pudding is rice to riches in NY and it wasn't as good as that.  I thought the rice could have been more mushy and more creamy.

But I still like their fro-yo. YUM.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Mix and match my own yogurt. You mean I can have espresso mixed with graham cracker crumbs mixed with caramel? Sounds gross? Well maybe. But one man's sweet tooth is another man's bleh.

I'm quirky, and Loving Cup lets me embrace my quirkiness. So an espresso graham cracker crumb caramel yogurt it is.

The thing is, it wasn't as good as I expected it to be.

And it's not because of my weird flavors. I know what I'm getting into. 

It's just that the flavors aren't popping out. They seem muted by the yogurt.

And at $5 a cup for yogurt I expect it to be the yogurt of my dreams.
author: Jack R.

description:
The search for the best frozen yogurt in SF is over! 

We strolled in around 9pm last night since I COULDNOTWAIT another second to try this magical treat. I've never been to their original location, so this visit was long overdue despite it being the day of their grand opening in Hayes. 

I love the simplicity of the process and the focus on the blended-in toppings. I can't wait to mix and match every possible topping combination. They blend each serving individually, which makes each order feel uniquely yours. 

We shared the Dirty Hipster-- vanilla base with Nutella and Oreos mixed in-- it was to die for. And because we were having so much fun and didn't want to end the party early, we followed up with the cookies and cream rice pudding. So delicious. 

The adorable girl who was managing the shop last night was both lovely and hilarious. I'd go back just to share a laugh with her again. I can't wait to be a regular visitor of the Loving Cup!
author: Meredith C.

description: LOVE THE DIRTY HIPSTER! So. Good. Please get it. I can't really say how the other flavors are because I always want the dirty hipster... But at my last visit, they accidentally made me a Cookie Monster, which they let me keep as they made me another Dirty Hipster - which was really nice of them! I gotta say I didn't really like the Cookie Monster though. Definitely paled in comparison to the Dirty Hipster. But 5 stars still for stellar service and making me another froyo after making me the wrong one! (AND letting me keep both)
author: Grace D.

description:
I would totally give this place 5 stars if it wasn't so dang expensive.

We got:
- vanilla yogurt with strawberries and graham crackers
- chocolate yogurt with english toffee and cookie dough

the vanilla one was really disappointing - was going for a cheesecake-y vibe but failed. It'd need more toppings to get it there, which would make it even more expensive than the $4.50 we're already paying for a small.

however, the chocolate one was ahhhmazing - seriously so indulgently good. 

I like that they blend the toppings together to create your own flavor of fro yo, but it's tricky to come up with the perfect combination, especially when it's $.75 additional per topping.
author: Amy Y.

description: Loving Cup is located in the Hayes Valley in SF.  It so happen it was the hottest day of the year in SF 106 degrees so in the attempt to cool off.  I ordered the peanut butter cup which has peanut butter and chocolate chips.  It was really good and filling. Prices are reasonable.  There is indoor and outdoor seating.  Located in a cute trendy neighborhood.
author: Val R.

description:
My favorite thing is the Dirty Hipster with toffee.

My friend got the Strawberry Shortcake, but she liked my order better.

This was my first time at this location (which I never knew was in Hayes Valley). It's super cute and definitely bigger than the Polk St. location.

Will come back again, my sweet tooth is addicted.
author: Jenna R.

description: I'm not quite sure on the yogurt part but I definitely love their rice pudding! Will walk right around the corner when I get the cravings.
author: Eunji C.

description: Love this place. I live in then South Bay, but I literally have to come here every time I'm in San Francisco. It might seem random to get rice pudding, but trust me, it's so good here & try it with their salted caramel topping. Their frozen yogurt is also super good too during the summer & the people who work here are always friendly.
author: Emily U.

description:
There's must be something wrong with me? 
I'm so addict to this place recently. 
I've try all the flavors of rice pudding. They are all good! I could die for this... 
For yogurt, I love Salty Dog badly! If you like salted caramel you will love this 100%.
Come here if you are searching for ice cream, dessert, sweetness around Hayes Valley
author: JustinE Y.

description:
I love the fact they blend all the toppings you want into your frozen yogurt.  I usually get vanilla plus english toffee, and then add a fruit flavor just to make it a bit healthier for my peace of mind.  The toffee bits creates a great crunch texture into the yogurt.
It's also nice they sell rice pudding in multiple different flavors, but they aren't as good as the yogurt.
They have a stamp card available, so that keeps me coming back.
author: Karen L.

description:
Rice pudding win!! With flavors that change daily and portion sizes chosen by you, this could easily be a guilt free, extra low calorie indulgence.

In froyo land, the toppings you choose are actually crushed and blended into your cup by a machine that spreads out the complimentary tastes. Making your own combination is key, or you could order from their "secret" posted menu.
The chocolate with pistachio is a solid choice!
author: Regina D.

description:
MUCH YUMMY, SO YES.

YES TIMES A THOUSAND.

1000x YES for:

- the best rice pudding in the worldddd.  Flavors on our visit included coconut, rum raisin, lemon, vanilla, cookies & cream, and bittersweet chocolate chip.
- the best froyo because you can basically create your own flavor combination (it's not just ingredients sprinkled on top - they actually mash it together with this super awesome machine that I now need in my kitchen).  My favorite is vanilla base + almond butter + english toffee.  It's like a butterfinger but better!
- clean, cute shop tucked around the corner from the hustle and bustle of Hayes Valley.
author: Tori S.

description:
I'm updating this review from 1 star to 3, as I received a thoughtful response from the owner explaining why their frozen yogurt clearly comes out of a box labeled ice cream.  

Response: "The box our frozen yogurt comes in has a label on the other side that clearly states LC (for Loving Cup) NF  (for Non-Fat) Frozen Yogurt.  The company that packs our yogurt is called Farr's Ice Cream.  But that is not a label for what is in the box, just a brand that co-packs for us so we can distribute to our shops.  We are too small a company to pay the extra for boxes printed with our brand at this time.  These boxes are pre printed and offered to us for free."

I appreciate the explanation and response; however, I would still not go back due to the cleanliness issue.
author: N T.

description:
This review is mostly a reminder to myself so I don't come back here and spend money..I don't like rice pudding. 

That being said, the people who work here are very nice. I had never tried rice pudding before so I sampled some flavors. The workers were so nice in fact, that I felt obligated to buy a rice pudding even though I didn't like it.

I think my brain is just wired to think rice pudding will be savory, like jook.
author: Angela L.

description:
This place is so bomb. My boyfriend and I got two orders of bulletproof (chocolate base mixed with peanut butter, topped with salted caramel)--came out to $9--but totally worth it. Definitely raised the bar and set a whole new standard to frozen yogurt. Super rich and creamy. Our friend ordered vanilla base topped with salted caramel--loved it! He finished half of it by the time we got our order! His came out to $3.75 (it's an extra dollar for every additional topping, so only 1 topping for free). 

4 stars cause it is a bit of a commute (totally worth it tho, tons of really great food places in the vicinity) and parking is a pain. But when is it not in the city. :)
author: Charlene P.

description:
I caught wind of this place because of the rice pudding mentions, but Loving Cup isn't known for their rice pudding. That's like an extra perk on the side. Their main thing is froyo and they do it well. Incredibly well. 

I got the Dirty Hipster (vanilla base, nutella, oreos) and added cookie dough. This was heavenly. It was sweet but not as sweet as I thought it would be. It was just really good.

This place reminds me of Cold Stone except instead of ice cream, froyo. It's such a good idea. Sometimes when I get froyo, I don't care for a lot of toppings because I don't want to be chewing my toppings while my froyo is already melted. 

I'll be back! I'm just bummed there's no closer location. Parking is pretty hard to find, but I guess you can get lucky or double park and run in (not recommended).
author: Jeannie L.

description: I've just forgiven a friend of mine who brought me a pint of the plain as a peace offering. Yes, I am weak.  I wish I were a size 2 again just so I could eat a bunch of rice pudding and get fat again.  Just like rolling a snowball down a hill. It is truly one of my worst temptations. The Octavia stop w/Blue Bottle Coffee a stones throw away is so close to my office, I've had to self exile myself from Hayes Valley. Rice pudding is euphoric. Couple it with gourmet caffeine, and it might possibly affect your parasympathetic system. Just kidding, or am I? I could probably make this stuff, but the spirit of rice pudding can only be evoked when it's cooked for you. It's like making your own cocktail, it's just not the same.
author: Evelyn K.

description: I liked the rice pudding here, which is a different type of dessert from what you're usually used to. It's also healthier. I'll come back again for this.
author: Alice S.

description:
So glad I live walking distance to this location! Been here 3-4x and each time I absolutely love my orders. I recommend trying a pre-made creation on your first visit so you're not overwhelmed with all the ingredients and options. My favorite creation that I've had is vanilla base, espresso powder, chocolate chips and cinnamon. I've also tried the chocolate base, but I think that's a little too rich and prefer the vanilla.

Why Loving Cup beats out most yogurt places:
+non fat yogurt - for those of you watching what you're eating, how awesome is this? 
+they have the BEST rice pudding -- my boyfriend insisted on getting that, as he's not big on frozen yogurt, and I ended up wishing I got it as well. The best flavor is the vanilla one with chocolate chips and cinnamon added in (cinnamon is free on rice pudding). Tip: Take a large to go and put it in your fridge for 30 minutes to get the best flavor. 

Why it got docked one star: $5 for a small cup of froyo is steeep. But still worth it when you're craving dessert. Also the interior is adorable, well lit, and has good music, so you can stay and enjoy your dessert indoors or walk to hayes/octavia and eat it outside! 

Verdict: Delicious and worth the visit!
author: Anu P.

description: Think Coldstone meets Smitten's in froyo form.
author: Joyce C.

description: The dirty hipster is fantastic - a little bit of oreo, a little bit of nutella, and a whole lot of deliciousness. It took a while for them to make the order since they only had one machine working, but it was well worth the wait. I like that it's a bit off the beaten path in hayes valley so it's not super crowded. I'd recommend this over the more popular smitten down the street.
author: Derrick W.

description:
I'm so glad I discovered this place!! 

Rice puddings are my all time favorite and not to mention mixed frozen yogurts, it's a win-win deal.

I got the Cookie Monster frozen yogurt this time- bomb.com!! 

Can't wait to hit the gym hard so I can go back for more.
author: Reet R.

description: I LOVE loving cup! My go to is the chocolate frozen yogurt/custard with Oreos and toffee. Chocolate on chocolate on chocolate, hell yeah. This place is the BOMB! Come here and satisfy all your sweet tooth cravins'. YUMMMMYYY
author: Janet K.

description: Love, Love, Love Loving Cup until we came in today. I brought my girlfriend and my nine-year-old niece, and witnessed unsanitary conditions by the staff using dirty rags on the floor and on food prep services. As a food and beverage manager of over 10 years, it was appalling. They also dropped multiple F-bombs and were insulting management over broken equipment. We left and went to three Twins ice cream instead. We also paid $10 less and had amazing customer service!
author: Rodney D.

description:
I was surprised at their smart idea of providing an elegant variety of rice pudding.It's way healthier than other sweet items.Quick to prepare ,quick to serve,guilt-free and super light.

It is also known as kheer.(Pronounced:Khe-eer) in India.

I tried the praline pecan and loved it.Will come again to try more and may be take some home.
author: Priyanka L.

description: The staff is always nice. My favorite is the dirty hipster but with chocolate instead of vanilla. The P B'nana smoothie is kind of a weird texture and I probably won't get that again.
author: R D.

description: Delicious frozen yoghurt that tasted creamier than full fat icecream! The salty dog is my favourite with the salty pretzel crushed into the vanilla soft serve and then drizzled generously with salted caramel sauce mhmmm!
author: Laura M.

description: We came here on very high recommendation of our daughter and were not disappointed at all. The vanilla with mango mixin was one of the best I have tried. I am a reluctant ice cream sort of person , but this was great because it was not sugar dripping sweet or too rich and creamy . Give it a try , you will be saying loving the cup
author: Roopali R.

description:
I'm a fan! I've discover Loving Cup as I was looking for a froyo fix when being in this area. Their concept is unique. They have two
Frozen yogurt bases (Vanilla/Vhocolate) that they mixed as you order with any of
Their 20+ toppings. 

I've tried the Dirty hipster as I like
Nutella and Oreo cookie. The order was perfect: 
A creamy mix of Frozen Yogurt Vanilla base with a spoonful of fresh Nutella (from the jar!) and Oreo cookies.

I'll definitely come back event bough it isn't on my main route to work :-/
author: Cedric L.

description:
I've tried this place about 6 months ago, so this review is delayed but I remember it tasting AMAZING...

I had the chocolate froyo mixed with banana. It was not too sweet... Can't wait to go back to try different mixes!
author: Susanna H.

description: Vanilla with cookie dough and oreo's...can't go wrong right? I was wrong. Then I told the girl I didn't like the cookie dough after one bite. She looked at me blank with no response. And I tipped them. I should have left it on the counter. Go to Smittens. Don't waste your money on this stuff. Would have tasted better if they didn't mush all the stuff inside so I can pick out the fake cookie dough/animal crackers they use.
author: Gessa C.

description: I wanted to like this place. The yogurt was good. The moment I walked in, though, i felt unwelcome. One boy and two girls behind the counter. Zero smiles and zero greetings. It was slow with only a few other patrons inside. Girl with the brown hair was actually sitting on a counter, which I am pretty sure is a health code violation. With hesitation bleached blonde girl with glasses approached the front counter and asked us "what we would like?" Honestly I would like for this business owner to take a long and hard look at their shop. Your product is good, but your customer service sucks. The place also felt dirty. Disappointing to say the least.
author: Lara O.

description:
While I was first drawn in to Loving Cup by the rice pudding, I now have a full-fledged addiction to the frozen yogurt.  It is hands down the best and also unique yogurt I have had.  My usual is now vanilla with oreo, junior mints, and rainbow sprinkles.

Their rice pudding is also phenomenal with unique and well executed flavors.  I especially love their madagascar vanilla, coconut, orange creamsicle, and lemon vanilla.  I was a tad bit disappointed with the pistachio as a pistachio lover myself.

This loving cup location is a little more spacious, brighter, and with more seating than the original location.  Also, it's wonderfully closer to home for me so I can visit even more often that I have been (and that's a lot).
author: Carrie C.

description: Never ever again. I ordered chocolate frozen yo with espresso flavor and after 1 bite thrown it into the trash. It's super sugary- watery substance and not tasty at all. Moreover the girl didn't give me full small size. But she was smiling and pleasant.
author: Yana C.

description:
I love Loving Cup, this was my first time at this location and the space is real cute and big. We ordered rice pudding with bittersweet chocolate chips, perfection!! 

Frozen yogurt small with vanilla ice cream, toffee chips, cookie dough. This was too sweet, and the guy didn't make a big swirly top! It was a smashed mess that only filled the cup to the rim, no bueno! 

I would come back and hope I get a big swirl next time. He was super busy, the place was packed and they were friendly still with the crowd of customers. They need to hire one more person. This was on a Friday night.
author: Karen T.

description:
Bottom line at the top: yum! 
--
Came in and had 'is this your homework larry'- vanilla froyo with almond butter and toffee. Great space and yummy froyo.
author: Dahlia S.

description:
i seriously love this place so much that i don't know what to do. it makes me soo happy when i think about it, talk about it, and eat it!

my bf and i first came to loving cup back in the beginning of 2015 since we love desserts. i have a huge sweet tooth. i fell in love. i went again the next day! now at this time, i was living in socal so was only able to go to loving cup when i visited my ldr boyfriend in sf. (i visited sf to see my bf but i do want to say that loving cup was a big factor)

fast forward to april 2015, i made the move to sf because i was offered a job here. i was told to create an intro "about me" slide for the whole company to see. of course, of the many pictures that described myself, i included the loving cup logo. yes, because it is an important part of my life and i'm proud of it!

i love u loving cup, u cup of love S2
author: Alex C.

description:
Saturday, 8:30 PM. 

Quickie:
+ Froyo quality
+ Service
+ Turnaround
+ Cleanliness

And then...?
Next up, rice pudding!

**********
Stuffed my face in:

1. Chocolate peanut butter
     + Yogurt did not detract from chocolate peanut butter. 

Constructive comment:
*Have more options for fruit?
author: Chuck N.

description: I don't know what's wrong with me and maybe I'm the only one, but I seriously have not had one good thing here.  I've had the normal froyo with mix ins. I've had the vegan banana froyo. I've had the rice pudding. I cannot eat any of those after the third bite, the taste isn't good!  The banana froyo is downright inedible, it's sour and unpalatable.  Maybe its just me and will only be me, but holla if you agree.
author: Terry K.

description: Great place and fantastic fro-yo, but the lousy service keeps me from giving a full five stars. The guy who served me was sullen to the core. What the hell did I do to you, dude? That said, the frozen treats are amazing. Try it, but don't expect smiles.
author: Allison L.

description: This place is a seriously awesome FroYo place. The method in which they mix everything is amazingly effective and feels like you've created your own custom flavors instead of sparse toppings sprinkled only on the top of your yogurt. It's very good, not too expensive, and the small size is actually perfect. Quality ingredients and has options for pretty much anyone (banana-based, dairy-free FroYo and more). Love it and will be returning many times.
author: Ian S.

description:
Tried the dirty hipster (oreo+nutella) and the vanilla with strawberries. The flavor of the strawberry one was very subtle and just mildly sweet. I think they keep the base minimally sweet so that when you add more toppings it tastes just right. The dirty hipster was perfect--loved the combo of oreos and nutella. Being more of an ice cream girl than a fro-yo girl, I can definitely say the dirty hipster fro-yo was right up there and comparable to some of my fave ice creams!

Tip: they don't do samples of the fro-yo because it's made to order, but you can sample their rice puddings. It was an interesting concept, but I was a bigger fan of the fro-yo ;)
author: Kavita S.

description:
Small little yogurt place near octavia street nestled in a quieter neighborhood just a few blocks away from hayes and van ness...

Keep in mind this is YOGURT not ICE CREAM so do adjust your flavor expectations accoridngly. The toppings options are fairly moderate in quantity and flavor, but if i had to make a choice based on overall results, flavor and options of what to build off of..

Strawberry Fruit Smoothie, really bland ..since its yogurt instead of ice cream but its fresh as advertised. Their options dont quite suit the taste buds at the moment.
