Ice cream has that sugary boost that makes you want to enjoy it...yogurt is more like keeping cool in the sun...nothing special about it really...anyhoow..

can't really complain since i knew it was a yogurt place to start, but they shouldnt need such  a big options full of topings, but at least have toppings or bases with flavors....actual flavors beisdes generic vanilla and chocolate..otherwise....theres no reason to flock to here if you compare to other sweet tooth locations in the city..

(i.e: ShareTea, BB Tea Station, Mitchells,TeaWay, Ghiradelli, Tutimellon, Pressed Juicery, Haagen Dazas)


Fraiche still has the cherry on top ....though this  establishment could try to catch up....they may win the locals if they add ice cream to the menu...esp now in summer...

Now you know who's your competition since you're in San Francisco..please break the trend....
author: Eric C.

description: I loved the vanilla bean rice pudding! My friend had the Dirty Hipster and it was a bit too sweet for me but still good! Great service!!
author: Cindy K.

description: I should have listened to my fellow Yelpers and ordered the Dirty Hipster, but since I LOVE (understatement) strawberries, I went with the strawberry shortcake. It was pretty bland. There was a unique, almost lemon like flavor to it, but that was it. Came here on a Thursday night around 9 so I was able to get my order in about 3 minutes. Good amount of space to sit and relax. Giving it another shot.
author: Thomas L.

description: So so yummy!!! Unlike most froyo places, Loving Cup blends in their toppings so it tastes more like ice cream. There's a menu of "recommended" combos though you're also free to make your own. My favorite is the Dirty Hipster which is a combination of vanilla yogurt, Oreos, and Nutella. With those ingredients, you can't really go wrong... Overall, great dessert spot in Hayes Valley if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Connie Q.

description: They have a list of froyo+mix-in combos, or you can pick your own froyo base and your own mix-ins (think a McFlurry but premium ingredients). I got the almond joy which was an almond butter froyo and chocolate chip+coconut mix-ins. There's also yummy rice puddings that I didn't order but I tried some of my friend's and everything was really good. I can't wait to come back the next time I'm in Hayes Valley to try some of their other flavors!
author: Stacey L.

description:
I have to say, it's fantastic to see a chill dessert spot that encourages sitting, lingering and hanging out with friends (or a date, whatevah). 

Loving Cup has a cute setting with blonde woods and plenty of seating including a bar counter. They have at least a half-dozen selections of fresh rice pudding available at any given time from coconut to vanilla to bittersweet chocolate. They're not too sweet and super generous with their portion sizes. Plus you can get two flavors in one cup - no tough decisions here! The fro-yo they offer is mixed in this crazy way with an intense looking machine and that topping list goes on and on. Definitely a relaxing place to swing by that's off the main street of Hayes Valley.
author: Faith Y.

description:
I think this place is so clever. Pick a base froyo and pick toppings. They blend the toppings into the froyo and there you have it. Textually amazing.

Tried "salty dog" which is essentially vanilla froyo plus pretzels and salted caramel. Love sweet and salty. Love pretzel bits in the froyo.

Mate tried "dirty hipster" which was also delicious. Vanilla froyo, oreos, nutella.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Loving cup is like a Coldstone version of fro-yo, sorta. You choose your base, either vanilla or chocolate and then your toppings, which they have a wide variety of. While Coldstone mixes your toppings in, Loving Cup puts all the ingredients together in this cool contraption that blends everything together. 

I went with the "Dirty Hipster," (haha) vanilla base, nutella, and oreos. I also added in some graham crackers. I personally wasn't too big of a fan. Because everything was so well blended together I didn't get the different textures that I normally like. It had tiny, tiny pieces of cookie pieces blended within it and didn't offer much of a crunch. 

Overall, I found it mediocre. Wouldn't necessarily make the trip out for it.
author: Glecie C.

description: This yogurt is delicious and fresh. Not like most froyo shops as you choose a base and topping to which they blend in together. Very different but oh so delicious. I have yet to order the rice pudding but I have heard it's very good. Will take my toddler there for some after dinner sugar high one of these nights.
author: Bri R.

description:
I love the environment around each of the two Loving Cups! 

The Loving Cup in Hayes Valley has a more extensive menu with suggested combinations for your frozen yogurt treat!! Each time I come here, it's the usual Dirty Hipster and the Vanilla Bean rice pudding! The uniqueness of how they mix the froyo and that sophisticated machine that rotates and mixes really fascinates me. It delivers some sugary tasty dessert too!
author: Hamilton C.

description:
Weekend (SF Pride Festival), 3pm, 2 people

Loving Cup was a place that I had bookmarked before I ever set foot in San Francisco, and when I finally got around to trying it, I realized it would be yet another place that keeps me here for the long haul.  We were hanging around Civic Center area for SF Pride, and walked the 5-6 blocks over to this location (the other location up Polk St is walkable, but about double the distance).  It was busy inside, but there were only 2 people between us and the counter in line, and we waited about 5 minutes after ordering - sufficient time to go to the bathroom.  The tables outside were open, so we sat outside for some prime time people watching.

I got the chocolate fro-yo with dark chocolate chips and espresso beans - chocolate overload!  They blend everything together before serving it, and I love how there are toppings in every bite.  If you get fro-yo at a self-serve place, usually your first 1/3 will be toppings, and your last 1/3 of the bowl will be just fro-yo.  You wouldn't know it was non-fat by eating it, either.  They give a generous amount over the top of the bowl, which is always a marker of a good place - don't skimp!  The prices on the menu are a bit misleading*, but the value proposition makes sense - customized, high quality fro-yo mixtures in downtown SF will cost this much.  A self-serve place might be $1-$1.50 less if you just pay by weight, so you are paying for them to mix it and a little bit of a premium.  

*The regular prices are listed on the menu as getting 1 topping for free, and $0.75 for each additional topping - all of the recommended creations have 2 toppings, so you need to add the $0.75 to the listed prices - there's no "$5.50" listed anywhere even though that's what you'll pay for a medium-sized recommended creation (like a 'Dirty Hipster', for example)
author: Ben K.

description:
SUCH a great concept!!! infusing your toppings into your froyo is genius and delicious! By far once of my favorite places for dessert 
I personally have not tried the rice pudding but it is raved about so I say TRY IT!
author: Nikita D.

description: Favorite ice cream store in SF hands down. I love vanilla base with strawberry and coconut. Not sweet and very refreshing! Much better than Bi-Rite and Smitten next door. MUST COME IN SF !!!!
author: Stephanie T.

description: Good froyo, but the first time I was here, they completely omitted a topping I paid for, and second time, I was turned away at 10:05pm on a Saturday despite an open door and a listed closing time of 10:30. Customer service could use work.
author: Rachel L.

description: Came here for the froyo and left with the coconut rice pudding.  This is the cold stones of froyo.  It isn't overly sweet and the pre made creations were good!  I tried the dirty hipster, salty dog and a custom almond butter with pecan and a vanilla based and there were all great.  I really liked the saltiness of the salty dog so that the sweetness shines.  Would come here again for dessert.  Hoping it is low calorie.
author: Haley Z.

description:
I saw this place on yelp and it looked unique and delicious. Thought it might be worth a twenty minute drive into the city and it might have been if parking wasn't so terrible. 
The yogurt was definitely good, great flavor and consistency and great ingredients to mix in. I personally like my yogurt topped though instead of blended in. I feel like you get more of the taste that way, but it was still good. 
If I lived close by and could walk there I'd definitely go back but because of the parking I really don't think it's THAT amazing to come back. If you're in the area and have a sweet tooth though I'd definitely check it out
author: Adam H.

description: I had a very pleasant experience. James was very helpful and delightful. I had the thin mint yogurt.
author: Chantel E.

description:
Cute little coffee shop ambiance, which is much different than most yogurt places. Pleasant cafe atmosphere invites you to sit down instead of just grabbing your yogurt and heading out. 

The yogurt is super smooth and creamy, reminds me of somewhere between a McFlurry and Cold Stone since you get to pick a base flavor and they actually blend it right in instead of just sprinkling it on top. If you can't decide they have a fun preset menu with fun hipster names for the combo flavors like "The Dude Abides"
author: Ariane B.

description: Frozen yogurt, Cold Stone style! The churned yogurt still had a thick, dense consistency which I love love love for frozen yogurt. I got the Salty Dog (pretzels and salted caramel) and it was amazing. If you told me it was soft serve ice cream, I would have believed it. Generous portions and friendly service as well! Can't wait to visit again.
author: Julia L.

description: Stick to what they're known for here which is the rice pudding. Very low quality and consistency with their soft serve type yogurt. Just got from post mates.
author: Sharon M.

description:
Great rice pudding is a wonderful thing. Sadly you won't find any here. For one thing, they use lowfat milk, which should seriously be illegal. For another thing, the texture is gloppy. The flavors aren't particularly appetizing either. 

If you're going to open a shop devoted entirely to frozen yogurt and rice pudding, shouldn't the level be higher than this?
author: Johnny A.

description:
An adorable soft serve/rice pudding shop in the beautiful and quaint Hayes valley.

Workers are always friendly and give great flavor suggestions! My favorite was the Cookie Monster - a must if you love Oreos.

A great little treat to have while walking around the nearby shops.
author: Rita C.

description:
I love this place!

I've tried both their rice puddings and their froyo. The rice pudding is to die for. I was never really into rice pudding before, but my boyfriend loves it and so I tried it out. Now I'm obsessed! It's creamy with a perfect texture and not-too-sweet taste. I love the lemon vanilla when they have it!

The froyo is also great- I love the concept of the blended toppings. The actual yogurt is pretty frozen /cold, and I generally like my ice cream/froyo to be a little melty, so that put me off, but otherwise  it has a nice tart flavor and can be very delicious. 

Overall an adorable place with seriously yummy dessert! Nothing is overly sweet and staff is friendly. Highly recommended!
author: Nicole R.

description: dudes working in there rude AF. maybe they're just used to serving rich teenage girls but really come on... acknowledge the people waiting on your service instead of just looking at your phone for 4 mins.. should have just walked out.
author: Sarah E.

description: The yogurt is amazing but I order through postmates all the time and the sizes are not consistent at all - it's always hollow in the middle and feels like a waste of money. If I order a pint I expect it to be a pint not a cup for $13 + all the other delivery charges. Dissapointing and I can't justify ordering it for deliver anymore :(
author: L V.

description:
I'm used to awesome rice pudding growing up with my mom's but this one comes oh so close. 

Not overly sweet, tasty, and a nice variety of flavors. Plus they have a friendly staff which doesn't hurt either. 

Wee bit on the pricier side but you expect that from Hayes Valley. I guess that's a good thing otherwise I'd be here everyday which would be terrible for my waistline.

Definitely coming back!
author: Alejandro T.

description: So good and a very cool concept! The staff is super sweet, but majorly understaffed. I always feel so bad for them! Hopefully they get some help, because that stuff is like froyo crack. Doubt the line will get any shorter. Oh, and the rice pudding!!! FML. Best I've had in the city so far.
author: Corinne A.

description: The froyo was great, even on a chilly day. The staff are social, helpful, and great for help on picking what to eat. Interestingly enough, what we ordered was all blended together. That was a little wierd but still yummy. I'm definitely coming back to try the rice pudding!
author: Stephanie R.

description: Drooling as I write about this! Absolutely the best rice pudding ever! And I don't even like rice pudding! Love love love the chocolate chip- it's not too sweet and super good when it's right out of their fridge. Better than ice cream on a hot summer day...or any day.
author: Jewel P.

description: Where else can you get freshly made rice pudding? They have a wide variety of flavours that change daily. I think all the flavours start with a standard rice pudding base, then have different toppings mixed in or added on top. Today I went and they had cinnamon rum and raisin (had raisins), vanilla, coconut (coconut flakes mixed in), bittersweet chocolate (small semi-sweet chocolate chips added on top), lemon, and cookies and cream (crushed up Oreos). They also have smoothies and frozen yogurt.
author: Chantal T.

description:
I've been to the original Loving Cup off Polk only once (mainly because of how far it is) and fell in love, but ever since they opened up this location, I've probably gone about once a week. This location is a little more spacious than the first location, and has a good amount of seating for you to enjoy your dessert. 

There's nothing new about the flavors they offer for their yogurt: you choose a frozen yogurt base (chocolate or vanilla), and any mix-ins you want. However, what they do differently is they put everything into a machine that perfectly blends your creation - gourmet mcflurry style. Their frozen yogurt is so delicious, creamy and heavenly...I'm craving it as we speak. My favorite combination is vanilla + Nutella, oreos and pistachios. Sure, their prices may a little be more than average, but it's soo worth it! For a small yogurt with 3 mix-ins (the first mix-in is free), I paid $5.72.

They also offer rice pudding with flavors that rotate daily. I've heard good things about their rice pudding, but I just haven't had the chance to try it yet.

FYI, 25 cent charge for paying with credit card, so bring cash!
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Every time I come to San Francisco from San Jose, I always make it a point to come to Loving Cup.  I haven't tried their frozen yogurts yet because I'm too infatuated with their rice pudding!  Super creamy and never lacking in flavor: it is definitely something to dream about.  The atmosphere is always chill and I've considered buying pints of the pudding to bring home.
author: Patricia L.

description:
A Loving Cup that's closer to my house, a lot bigger, new, clean and pretty, and a "secret menu" that has a good amount of yogurt combo suggestions so I don't have to make one myself?! I'm thinking WINNING. Can't wait to come here like, every weekend. 

Had the dirty hipster and the strawberry shortcake. Both were good, but that dirty hipster though... Do it.
author: Chrisy Y.

description:
?! CUSTOMIZABLE FROYO?! Holy S--excuse my language.

I MADE MY VISIT A PROFILE PICTURE.  You can probably figure out how satisfied I was. :D

The list of flavors for the frozen yogurt are not exactly toppings.  More like customizable ingredients, ready to be crushed into a unique froyo Mcflurry goo!  The variety of the ingredients is fantastic.  Hell yeah I would love that nutella whipped into my froyo.  Can I get an amen?

Try the special recommendations to the right of the Froyo menu.  If it's too hard choosing a flavor, ask the employee!  The server is very chill, and pro at crushing food deliciously.

I feel this place is good enough to rival nearby Smitten!  It's definitely a fitting edition to the gourmet neighborhood.
author: Hyun S.

description: Their rice pudding alone is a solid 4 stars, which was what I tried during my first visit here. It was really tasty, but I didn't find it amazing. I was surprised to see both locations with 4.5 stars up until last weekend when I finally tried their froyo. Omg so good. Their froyo + topping mixer idea is genius. I tried their seasonal pumpkin pie - graham crackers, cinnamon, and pumpkin purée blended with vanilla froyo. Amazing. The texture was more similar to ice cream than froyo after being mixed in their magical machine and I could really taste all the different flavors! My bf ordered the Dirty Hipster - Nutella and Oreos mixed into vanilla. Really sweet, but still delicious. They have a bunch of other combos on their menu too, but you can also create your own. Can't wait to come back and try more!
author: Stephanie G.

description: I went with my friend and we had a tough time choosing Smitten or Loving Cup, but we thankfully decided on trying Loving Cup! I love the variety of flavors and the freedom to choose--who knew strawberries, peanut butter, and rainbow sprinkles would actually be a perfect combo? Prices are decent for what you get in terms of size and quality of the items used in the final product. The staff was super helpful, and very nice and welcoming! It just took kind of a while go get our orders.
author: Alison M.

description:
Love this place - I usually get the soft serve over the pudding but that's a personal preference.

Nutella and peanut butter is awesome
author: Jeff H.

description: I can never go back to Yogurtland or any self-serve froyo place after having Loving Cup. There's something about having your choice of toppings thoroughly mixed into the yogurt that makes it feel like you're creating your own customized flavor. My favorite combination is the Cookie Monster, which is vanilla yogurt with Oreos and cookie dough. The way the froyo is mixed makes the texture more like ice cream rather than froyo, and the chunks of Oreo and cookie dough are consistent, rather than running out of topping once you reach the bottom of your bowl. There's nothing like Loving Cup, and I will more often than not choose it over ice cream as well.
author: Ashley T.

description: I like more exotic bases of group, but this one is pretty good for people who are into chocolate and vanilla. I just love how consistent each bite was with the mixed toppings.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
The difference between Loving Cup and other frozen yogurt places is this:

Other frozen yogurt places put your toppings on top of your frozen yogurt; Loving Cup puts them inside.
author: A A.

description:
I am so lucky this opened just a few steps from my apartment. In the month it has been open I have been there a gazillion times.

Rice pudding and frozen yogurt are both delicious. 

But people with food allergies beware: There are always remnants of the last customer's order in my cup. If you're allergic to peanuts, etc., you should avoid the frozen yogurt here.

They have cute little tables outside--perfect for bringing my dog.

They charge 25 cents to use your credit card on orders under $10.
author: Marcella D.

description:
Small portions but easily the best frozen yogurt I've had - the texture was almost more of a custard consistency.  Not your standard "add your own toppings, pay by the pound" yogurt spot.. you pick a mix in with one of their basic flavors and they serve it up for you.

As others mentioned, more of a cafe feel than other yogurt places.  

Good spot to grab a cold treat and head to the park a block away.
author: John L.

description: Yummy! I was so excited to try this place. It's not hard to miss because its on a corner next to an alley. It has a very simple, yet vintage atmosphere that I like. I wanted to bring my boyfriend here because he loves rice pudding and I heard its amazing here. I wanted to try the freshly made frozen yogurt. I sampled the coconut rice pudding and it was good, but I wanted the banana bread frozen yogurt. As I watched them make it, it was pretty cool! They used fresh ingredients and I could really taste the banana. My boyfriend got the cookies n cream rice pudding, which was good too! I loved how the frozen yogurt was thick but soft. It wasn't even melting, even after about 10 minutes. I got a small and it was HUGE! It definitely satisfied my cravings for something sweet, yet balanced. I will definitely come back whenever I happen to be in the area!
author: Audrey K.

description:
I've never been blown away by the amount of flavors a frozen yogurt shop had to offer. It's usually a pretty easy process, but I had to take a minute to decide. Like, I had to ponder. 

I went with the peanut butter chocolate combo and it was so creamy and delicious. Apparently, everything is organic and stuff, too, so you can feel less bad about yourself.
author: Sam D.

description:
If you're looking for amazing fresh yogurt churned with love and your favorite toppings by a friendly staff, look no further! Holy deliciousness. I've seriously been thinking of this place for the past 3 days. If I didn't live in Petaluma, I would have already been back. Do yourself a favor and get the Salty Dog - vanilla yogurt with pretzels and home made caramel sauce. So simple. So perfect. 

All organic and fat free - well fat free before you add all the yummy goodies. But so worth it! I kept saying: Are you sure this isn't  ice cream?! 

I admit it, I might be drooling. I have a feeling that when I'm pregnant this will be the thing I drive an hour into the city for to satiate my cravings! Who am I kidding, I'm craving it RIGHT NOW!
author: Brandi L.

description: The name Loving Cup is very fitting because boi am I loving these cups.  The Dirty Hipster is phenomenal, its my second favorite dirty hipster (second, of course, to actual dirty hipsters). The blond girl with black glasses was very helpful, asked me "What would you like?" Overall, I rate 10/10, had a good time.
author: Emily H.

description:
In relation to its original location- this loving cup offers tons of space and time- time to linger and chat for awhile. Parking like the  Union Street location can be tricky. Although her location on Octavia off of Hayes makes this for a quiet rendezvous with your hunnies.  I was surprised to see it so quiet when we visited on a Friday night. I do hope that business picks up.

Their offering remains the same, in one word -"Fabulous!" the pudding and I are tighter than white on rice. My favorite is the coconut.  Or.....Get your whirl on. Get crazy and negate the goodness of probiotic yogurt by adding on the likes of gummy bears, cereal toppings, chocolate, Oreos and everything else in the sink.  The probiotic will work wonders for your digestive system and at the end of the day (or beginning) your body will love and thank you for it.
author: Michelle B.

description:
myself
best friend
brother
sis-in-law
nephew
niece...........................we all have such great love with their frozen yogurt.
 the usuals: vanilla w/ salted caramel, mango & s'berries, oreos & PB, english toffee, & espresso.
author: Nelle A.

description:
I'm happy this place opened up in Hayes Valley, way closer to me than their original location!

I was super stoked to try the rice pudding because there definitely aren't many stores that sell it! The guy working the counter was really nice and let me sample a few flavors; the vanilla was a bit bland but the chocolate chip rice pudding was pretty good so I ordered a small cup of that. They take credit cards but I thought it was kind of annoying that they ask you to tip, especially if you are taking your treat to go. 

The serving size is reasonable, but I wasn't blown away by the rice pudding. It was pretty good but the flavor wasn't really potent enough so it got boring after awhile. Maybe the fro yo is better than the rice pudding?
author: Sam F.

description:
Loving cup hayes valley converted me to a frozen yogurt believer. Other than the deliciousness of everything served here, another big factor is the location: an almost all white store front hugging the corner of leafy Ivy street and Octavia corner, its almost always quiet regardless how busy Hayes street is, the side walk is clean, the outside seating is comfy and stylish. Wifi is consistent, best of all, unlike coffee shop packed with permanent laptop users, relatively few people know about this gem. So come as often as you can, before they are becoming too famous among locals. 

http://goo.gl/v3o1cn
author: Grant G.

description:
Amazing! I had never before and a friend recommended it. The rice pudding (vanilla) is out of his world. Frozen yogurt is awesome, especially cause they mix in the toppings you want. 

Loved it
author: Mehdi A.

description: The worst staff at the Hayes store tonight. They were all stoned and unprofessional. I rather go to the Polk st. Store going forward.
author: Gulshan L.

description: Great, friendly service at the counter. They have many options for you to customize your dessert: from added toppings and seasonings for the delicious rice pudding, to completely customizable frozen yogurt. I opted for the Madagascar vanilla bean rice pudding with cinnamon and nutmeg on top & I couldn't have been more pleased with the delicate consistency and delicious flavors. Two thumbs up!
author: Sarah B.

description:
The only thing Hayes Valley needed was a frozen yogurt place and now Loving Cup is here and it's sooooo good!! 

quality fro yo and a great atmosphere! 5 stars for sure
author: Ashley B.

description: The yogurt is always fresh , the service is always wonderful and my favorites are P b anna shake , salty dog , coconut rice pudding and the frozen strawberry lemonade . I love my loving cup !!!!!!
author: Eric V.

description: Terrible service. Athena, the cashier, when asked a very simple question about the menu, replied to me with a rude response and a dirty look. Very unprofessional on her part. Truly hope that Athena doesn't have such a bad attitude during all of her shifts :/ tisk tisk.
author: Celeste L.

description: Loved my experience at Loving Cup. Great selection of flavors and happy to see composting and recycling happening there too!
author: Josie C.

description: Loved Loving Cup!  Nice change of pace from the swanky joints on Hayes St and the FroYo was fab.  Did not try the rice pudding but looking forward to it next time.
author: John A.

description: After seeing the freakishly long line at Smitten's, I decided to walk down the street instead. The workers here are really friendly, and there was no line when I got here! There is a big list of things you can blend in your frozen yogurt, so you can decide to have a super yolo dessert or just something light and fruity. My family got a vanilla with banana+pecan, strawberry shortcake, and chocolate with strawberry+waffle cone. I loved the waffle cone, which made the yogurt have super crunchy bits in it. The price is reasonable for what you get I think. I wish I lived closer so I could come more often!!
author: Joanne L.

description: My friends took me here and i fell in love!! it's like yogurt but it taste like ice cream.. idk you just have to try it for yourself. It's such a different yogurt experience because you choose your toppings and then they like blend it all together! I got raspberry and chocolate chips with vanilla (ya i guess it does sound kinda gross) but it was soo so good!!! The people who work there are also super nice. They got my friends order wrong so then they just gave her the wrong one for free and made her correct order! (:
author: Stephanie W.

description: Probably the first time I've come across the place with various rice puddings on sale. Such deliciousness is a rare find, and I just had to come in to try some. Got the cinnamon raisin version, and enjoyed every bite! Smooth, not too sweet, and just the right amount for a mid afternoon snack. The price is decent, and it's kind of like ordering a cup of ice cream or frozen yogurt. I'm a happy camper!
author: Kevin J.

description: Loved the froyo and the service was great..friendly and professional young women working the counter. Offered  me a taste of the rice pudding  which Was delish. I recommend the salted caramel pretzel froyo..yum!
author: Wendy L.

description:
Who knew frozen yogurt could taste just as good real ice cream? Not I. 

My friend has been raving about this place for the last couple months so we finally got our asses to hayes valley and treated ourselves to some fat girl treats! I like all the fun flavors they have, like "dirty hipster" (nutella / oreos / vanilla froyo). Similar concept to Coldstone: ice cream with mixed in toppings made to order. Will definitely be back!

Treat yourself!
author: Grace Y.

description: The best way to describe what you're going to get: Fancy McFlurry. While slightly pricey for a frozen yogurt treat (4.50 for a small), Loving Cup is so worth it! They have 2 locations, one in Hayes Valley and one in Russian Hill, which are both equally as delicious based on my experience. I personally love mixing in banana to the vanilla yogurt and adding either toffee or salted caramel. If you're more of a chocolate person, they also have a chocolate base to start with as well. Personalized frozen treats, such a smart concept. And definitely worth the trip!
author: Samantha C.

description: Second time here and I'll continue to return. Endless flavor options, you can get some rice pudding, and smoothies, soooo good! Today I had the mocha chip off the secret menu which was espresso beans and chocolate chips blended into chocolate frozen yogurt. There were huge chunks of chocolate and good coffee flavor, I love the texture of their frozen yogurt so freaking much! It's a perfect treat for any weather. Also, the staff are super friendly and the store is really clean.
author: Moni E.

description:
Heaven!

I'm so happy that I don't have to trek up to Union and Polk to get my hands on this good stuff. I tried a new flavor today: English Toffee. SO GOOD. 

I haven't had a bad cup yet! More seating at this location too so it's the perfect spot to end up after a stroll through Hayes :).
author: Joy A.

description:
How exciting is it to have a Loving Cup one block away from your workplace?
A: Quite.

Pro: It's customizable. Con: It's variable.
Individuals decide how much fruit, caramel, or other topping goes into your froyo, so you can leave with a cup that's unbelievably flavorful and delicious, or one that is slightly underwhelming. Most of the time though, it's pretty good. 

Pro: It's made-to-order. Con: It can get crowded.
When there's only one person serving a line of 10+ people and that person has to hand-crank every order, it not that great for everyone involved. I've been here when there are two people behind the counter and no one else in sight, and when it's packed out the door and there is one poor girl left to work the whole place. 

Best flavor combos? Anything with their homemade caramel, but especially: caramel + chocolate froyo + pistachios, and caramel + vanilla froyo + toffee. Mmm...
author: Maria A.

description: I went here to get a salty dog froyo and there was an older lady and I saw her disrespecting the employees which made me uncomfortable because, from these reviews, it says that living cup is a warm fun place. I've been here before and the workers seem like they know what they're doing but this lady is always criticizing them about everything and honestly that is embarrassing for the workers and is bad for business. It slows down the workers performance.
author: Punaofo A.

description: Got a vanilla base with raspberry and waffle cone and did not really like it. I really like the concept and the environment/location of the place though. Next time ill be trying their smoothies, hopefully those will be better.
author: Josue V.

description: Amazing frozen yogurt place! The only problem is that it's hard to decide which toppings to get because they're all delicious.
author: Chrissi K.

description:
AMAZING! A little pricey but SOOOO worth it.
I got frozen yogurt of course and mixed up an amazing taste for my buds...tastebuds that is: oreo cookie, salted carmel, peanut butter in a chocolate base...o...m...g
staff was friendly and quirky.
Only neg was the price, a littttttle steep there for something I downed in 4 min.
author: Rahbecka G.

description: Like other reviewers have said, the loving cup is like a frozen yogurt version of coldstone where the toppings are blended in instead of just put on top of the yogurt. I got a vanilla yogurt with sprinkles, cookie dough, and Oreo and it was awesome- the ratio of yogurt to topping was perfect and the toppings were the perfect size- not too chunky so they over power the yogurt but not too small so they get lost in it. Also, the guy making it was super friendly.
author: Jo S.

description: Love this place! Tried it for the first time last week. Refreshing and endless blend options. And their rice pudding is delish and fresh. Can't wait to go back for more!
author: Charlene C.

description: I really like this place, since I m a die hard fan of Rice Pudding!!! So surprised they serve really good rice pudding in a Froyo place, not a middle eastern place. I had the coconut flavor, which u can tell its not artificial taste, u can actually taste the shredded coconut inside. Not too sweet, perfect match with the rice. The service is great, atmosphere is relaxing. You should come!
author: Natasha L.

description: Just had their cinnamon rum raisin rice pudding and it was so damn good. My mom makes this for Thanksgiving and Christmas and when I sampled it here it tastes just like it. This is a compliment because mama makes the best.  I got a large rice pudding to go.
author: Shirley L.

description:
So I'm sitting here enjoying this wonderful cup of salty dog. Seriously, it's like the best thing ever made. I love this flavor.  1 star

Unfortunately, I wish the service or care of the customer was as good as their product. I've been here twice and the guy here is totally nice. I guess he makes the ice cream because both times he was manning the machine. 1 star. 

However, the rest of the staff seem very upset to be there or unfriendly. I didn't want to ask to try a second sample of rice pudding because the girl pretty much hit me with a "yeah what do you want" with a stone cold straight face. When me and my girlfriend order she told us the total and just swung the iPad around and walked away to talk to the guy. I then asked for a frequent card to be stamped and she just took it without acknowledgement and stamped it. I made it a point to say thank you to let her know I appreciated her service. The whole time she didn't even give me eye contact and said something under her breath. 

This happened with another cashier the previous time as well. Not friendly or seemed helpful at all. They just seem that they don't want to be there. 

All the while the guy is making the ice cream greeting customers and wishing them a goodnight. He engages the customers at the bar and seems to have regulars. He is a star employee. 

Loving cup please stop hiring employees that make your customers feel awkward. 

Great product. They have 1 good sales associate. Everyone else seems unhappy to be here.
author: J V.

description: So happy there is a second store! Best frozen yoghurt in the world. I think the best flavor combo is Oreo and pretzels.
author: Amy M.

description: Absolutely loved the frozen yogurt. It is a lot creamier than the typical frozen yogurt concoctions you normally find, probably because of the way it is blended. I highly recommending combining the Chocolate with espresso beans. Decadent and creamy. Also a small fills you up and satisfies your sweet craving.
author: Alyssa D.

description:
This is no doubt the BEST fro-yo I have ever had. EVER.

The flavors are so unique and amazing. I tried the Peanut Butter one (forgot it's actual name) and it was unreal. The texture is fabulous, the actual eatery itself is never busy and barely ever has a line, and the price (although higher then your average 'gurt joint) is manageable. 

Please, give this place a shot. You won't regret it.
author: Professional Yelper M.

description: The HEALTH DEPARTMENT should pay a visit to this location ASAP. The owners of this place should fire the people currently working there. I ordered a frozen yogurt with 3 or 4 toppings and it took a super long time. When I finally got it, the girl handed it to me and said, "Sorry, it's melted." WTF. It's FROZEN yogurt. Why would anyone serve it melted. I returned it and she said it melted because of the cookie dough. That was a lie. They made me a second batch, and it was still melted. That's when they confessed that there was something stuck in the machine and they are switching out the old frozen yogurt in there or some other bullish. By this time I said to just make me a simple order without the cookie dough. The third try was perfectly frozen and delicious...until my third bite. Something was in the yogurt that tasted foreign and I picked it out of my mouth. It was SHARDS OF PLASTIC. I was pissed. I held my tongue and asked for a refund and told them to clean the machine so they don't serve plastic to the customers again.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Decent rice pudding.   Cute shop in the oh so hip Hayes Valley...  Can you say, "G E N T R I F I C A T I O N?"
author: J M.

description: Yummy! The coconut rice pudding was wonderful! Loved the yogurt too. Waitress was very nice.
author: Kathy C.

description: The regular frozen yogurt is amazing. I mixed with strawberries and chocolate chips and it came out delicious. I just think it is a bit pricy.
author: Natasha S.

description: Froyo okay. Nothing amazing but not bad. We didn't love the rice pudding but they let us sample which was nice. Too many other options so probably won't be back.
author: T K.

description: Came here with some friends who are obsessed with this place, and now I see why. I got the cookies and cream rice pudding, and am now addicted to loving cup. Haven't been back since for my own good, but I'll cave eventually. If you have a sweet tooth and are in Hayes Valley or on Polk...do it.
author: Ron A.

description: Tried the rice pudding- SO GOOD! But I actually got the Dirty Hipster froyo. It was very good! And the shop is super cute and clean!
author: Anjelica E.

description: I just LOVE this place! I normally always get the froyo, but tried the rice pudding for the first time the other day and it was also amazing! I normally get the Salty Dog- soooo good! Also the employees are always so friendly and fun- there's a guy and a girl with glasses I always see who are super funny and helpful with choosing! Such a great neighborhood place! Also it's less busy than the one on Polk, and has more seating- so I definitely recommend!
author: claire l.

description: 3.5 stars. My friends and I originally wanted to go to Smitten but they had a super long line and we decided to go to Loving Cup instead....and got greeted with another long line that was almost out the door. Oh well, we decided to go with Loving Cup. I got the Thin Mint in a large...which was good but for $7.75? Pricey in my book. I originally wanted to get the banana bread but apparently they had ran out of bananas. Minus a star for that. If I'm in the area I might stop by again to try their strawberry shortcake froyo.
author: Cindy B.

description: yummy fro-yo, any taste combination, all mixed together in one clean, smooth, loving cup :)
author: Caroline L.

description: Salted caramel frozen yogurt didn't have much flavor, neither did their mango. Probably won't be back.
author: Ami B.

description: This place is great. I went about two weeks there. I had a vanilla with coconut & pineapple frozen yogurt. It was absolutely delicious. The guy working there, was very nice. I also thought the little shop looked very cute, neat, and clean. I'll definitely be going there often.
author: Berlin M.

description: The best frozen yogurt spot in SF. The place itself has a cute ambiance and servers are friendly. You get to pick a base yogurt flavor and then add whatever mix-ins you'd like from a huge selection of toppings. Cookie Monster is my fav!! The yogurt is creamy and rich in flavor. Definitely recommend if you're in the area!
author: Taylor E.

description: LOVE IT. Happened to stop by this place on a whim and its a cute little froyo shop. I was surprised to see that they have rice pudding there (which I have to try next time). You can think of this place like a hipster version of Coldstone. You can pick you froyo flavor & add mix-ins which they'll slow churn for you, or you can get something off the menu that's premade. I chose vanilla froyo with nutella & graham crackers and it was AMAZING. Definitely a place I'd come back to due to all the different variations I can get with my froyo! They also have stamp cards; my weakness that keeps me coming back lol :)
author: Nikki W.

description: I can't resist this place! The frozen yogurt is so good! The staff are always really friendly and helpful too. Living Cup is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood.
author: Janelle M.

description: I liked the idea of mixing the base with various ingredients, however when I got the vanilla base with strawberry and Nutella I could barely taste some chocolate.  They should improve the portions of different ingredients in order to make the flavors more distinct.  Overall, a lovely place!
author: Vanessa K.

description: I'm not typically a sweets kind of guy, but damn, Loving Cup does it right.  I'll be honest, I haven't rummaged around their menu too much because after my very first time there I was immediately hooked to their vanilla rice pudding mixed with crushed Oreo's.  How can you do that wrong when it's so simple and traditional.  Both locations (the original being in Russian Hill) are not high on occupancy but honestly, this is exactly how I would want it.  With anyone and everyone having Square, payments are made easy.  Based on the atmosphere, I would say this would be perfect for a date or just a quick stop as you stroll through Hayes Valley.
author: David W.

description: I love rice pudding and i will definitely suggest this store.. I got coconut rice pudding it was heaven right sweetness and its cold so its perfect and its just so good too bad i got only small next time il get the large one its
author: Gladys D.

description:
I've been hearing about this place for a couple months now, and I finally got to try it. Even as I walked through the door, I fell in love with the simple, cute, industrial-feel decor. I'm not a crazy fan of ice cream, especially super sweet ice cream, but loving cup really is a cup full of love! I was overwhelmed at first by all the combinations of ice creams + mix-ins, so I just browsed through the "Secret Menu" list that has 10+ options of popular ice creams + mix-ins. I was torn between the Dirty Hipster (I think that's what it was called.. with Vanilla ice cream + oreos + nutella) and the Go do my homework, Larry (with chocolate ice cream + almond butter + English toffee). But the cashier was very friendly and explained to me that the Dirty Hipster tasted more like a sweet candy bar and the other was more hearty and filling so I went with the latter and I LOVED it! It had a thick and creamy consistency but it wasn't too sweet or overwhelming, and the little chunks of English toffee made it perfect :)

I'll definitely be back! Good ice cream, friendly staff, CUTE decor & it's not too crowded!
author: Joyce L.

description: Love the Froyo! So so so good!! Love how the machine blends the topping you choose into the yogurt. I have gotten several combos and they are all so good. It's hard to go wrong. My father tried the rice pudding and said it was phenomenal. Dislike the rude cashier. God, I hope he isn't the manager or owner. He is awful- doesn't even acknowledge you when you're standing at the cashier- makes you wait about 5 minutes while he finishes what he's doing before even looking up. One star off for the service. I will still come back for the goods and try to get into a bad mood. Lol. Hopefully the rude dude will be gone. I love that the place is super clean too- kind of not the norm in a lot of areas in SF. Try it! It's delicious.
author: Piper W.

description: Do you guys know yogen fruz? Before Korean frozen yogurt craze was launced (Pink Berry, Yogurtland, yada yada....) This place reminds me so much of my childhood back in the 90's, back home, not in the US. Google Yogen Fruz.......You pressed the yogurt into machine with other toppings. Yep that one. I like it, I like to make my own. For me the yogurt is perfect, not overly sweet like typical American level sweetness. I don't like too sweet. Someone commented how sweet it is, I guess it comes from the oreo itself and other sweet toppings that you put. I agreed, like cookie dough is also on very sweet side. When I choose pineapple, the pineapple taste is a bit lacking. I preferred healthier toppings than cookies, all those stuff. Not a bad place, yes Hipster Hayes Valley.
author: Clemencia S.

description: Not your usual froyo place, but it was great nonetheless! I got the dirty hipster, Oreo and Nutella, and it was great! The Oreo and cookie dough is good too. The price was semi high, but it's San Francisco after all. The atmosphere was laid back and relaxed and i can't wait to go back!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Loving Cup is delightful. I ordered a pumpkin + cinnamon froyo (to die for), and they loved the combo so much that they named it after me and made it the flavor of the day. :) James was incredibly kind and epitomized good service. The ambiance is great, the frosted animal crackers add a good splash of color, and there is plenty of space inside to hang out. Love this spot!
author: H L.

description: Ordered a Dirty Hipster, and despite the kinda groanworthy name, it was really quite good.  I'm not sure if I could actually taste the Oreo much since the Nutella kinda understandably overwhelmed it, but next time I'll probably get some toffee because fuck my heart and health.  I wish I could say more about it but it was just a pretty pleasant, quietish (it was a rainy Saturday, so I get the feeling this will change during the summer), affordable place to get some quick sweets.
author: Norman S.

description:
hi,

so happy they opened in Hayes, we need it frozen yogurt! at Hayes Valley :) friendly staff, clean decor, good for families and couples and open late!  So many flavors, my fav chocolate with blueberries
author: Jenya B.

description: I was sick and a dear friend brought me Loving Cup's rice pudding. I made a miraculous recovery. Nuff said.
author: Susan K.

description: Love, happiness, cute cold bites in a cup. This place will fill your heart with joy... Pure bliss. I loooove this place!!
author: Razan A.

description: Great frozen yogurt but craaaaaappyyyyyy service- the employees could at least try to give one f**k.
author: g g.

description: This place is so adorable! You can sample your bread pudding to make sure you get the one you like, and my server was the sweetest thing ever (: I got coconut rice pudding with rum soaked raisins on top. My friend got cinnamon rum raisin with no toppings and his was way better. Both were amazing though.
author: Emma G.

description: The Loving Cup is so good. Nonfat frozen yogurt made on the spot and blended with different delicious ingredients so it's like a really thick milkshake, but eaten like soft serve. It tastes amazing without being overly sweet. I want to eat this every day.
author: Justine S.

description:
Upon waiting 1.5 hours for dinner a couple of my friends wanted to try this place so we walked here and enjoyed dessert before dinner.; this specific shop, on Octavia, opened 5 weeks ago, so I didn't know about until one of my friends brought it up.  Their rice pudding is well-known and I was a bit hesitant to try, simply because I had a preconceived notion that rice pudding is supposedly heavy.  One of workers was really nice to allow us to sample all their flavors prior to decision-making.  After my first sample, I find that their rice pudding had the thickness of oatmeal and the consistency of Chinese-style porridge (jook), however unlike oatmeal or porridge, it was not dense, but rather unexpectedly light. Sounds confusing, but it's something one MUST try to fully understand.  After sampling all their flavors, I ordered the Cinnamon Rum Raisin with strawberries and extra rum raisins.  BOMB.COM  It's light enough where I wanted more, but had to save my stomach...boo =(  too bad I was full from dinner because I really wanted to return, that same night, for more.

The location is in an hipster area, but it's definitely located perfectly off a few short blocks away from the noise of cafes, restaurants, and bars.  After enjoying a meal, drinks, and/or coffee, guests can stroll over, taking a break from crowds, (where people may have a harder time hearing conversations) and settle down with a great cup of rice pudding (and be able to chat comfortably with friends). 

Prices are very reasonable for their quantities; will return (possibly try the Polk St. shop) for their customizable fro-yo
author: Jessica S.

description:
Not as yummy as I hoped. Bland even with all the mix-ins. 

 It was my first time trying Loving Cup, I ordered through Postmates because they hella got me with that promo today for 2 free yogurts. For some reason there was no option for an additional order that i could purchase so I deleted my free yogurts and had to go to the regular page to order and ended up ordering 3 pints and you know...i just didnt want the  postmates delivery guy to come all the way here just for two little ass yogurts.

Whatever. Anyways. So I ordered 3 different mixes:
Chocolate w/espresso and peanut butter, 
Vanilla w/ mango, pineapple and coconut, 
and Vanilla w/ strawberry, almond butter and graham crackers. Those don't sound gross right?! Well they were all pretty blah.

The vanilla base seemed a little icy and tasted like watered down milk with not even a hint of vanilla. The mix-ins were pretty weak in taste as well - my strawberry, almond butter and graham cracker tasted like special k cereal w strawberry and low fat milk. The one with the pineapples and mangoes should have been bursting with flavor but it didnt. The chocolate one had a better texture, it was smooth and thick probably with the help of the pb. Flavor wise, it needed more chocolate and the pb was still lost in there somewhere. The only flavor that was strong was the espresso. 

I think the bases should have been able to stand alone -which is obvious that it can't- and that adding all these mix ins would be an extra bonus for your taste buds -those didnt help much either.  I may as well have just licked an ice cube had I known it would turn out this way.
author: Mila B.

description: I moved here from NYC where I lived 2 blocks from a store that sold 28 flavors of rice pudding.  When I moved here, I was disappointed to find this was not a thing every neighborhood has.  I was excited when my boyfriend pointed this out as a "rice pudding" shop last weekend and I returned within just a few days to check it out.  Sadly, they only have about 5 flavors of rice pudding and it seems a majority of the business is devoted to froyo.  Also, it is a bit expensive compared to even a rice pudding shop in SoHo, NYC.  However, it is good rice pudding and I will return for more.
author: Kelly M.

description:
My friend brought me loving cup the other day. He told the girl working to surprise him because he didn't know what I'd like.. It was the most incredible frozen yogurt i'd ever had. It had chocolate hazelnut and crushed waffle cone to give it some crunch!

This was my first time trying Loving Cup. I will definitely be in for more frozen yogurt!
author: Harris G.

description: Peanut butter, banana with chocolate blend is amazing.  Great service, good people. Had time during lunch to grab a seat and use their wifi to take a break.  Look forward to going back!
author: Al S.

description: The best frozen yogurt I have ever had! I live for frozen yogurt and this by far blows every other place out of the water. Went twice in one day! Rice pudding is also amazing!
author: Ashley C.

description: The employees that work here are so fun! It's a great place to come if your day isn't going that well, you'll feel much better after the yummy treats and great people!
author: Katrina M.

description: We just happened to be staying nearby and was walking back to the hotel and came across Loving Cup. Dessert was sounding good after pizza so we walked in to check things out. To our pleasant surprise, they had rice pudding in a small variety of flavors as well as frozen yogurt. You don't see rice pudding too often so we decided to go with that. We didn't even ask for a sample taste first...we just went for it. I had the vanilla bean rice pudding with homemade caramel sauce... So delicious! My daughter had the coconut rice pudding with homemade chocolate sauce. They lined the cup with the chocolate sauce so it made a chocolate shell and then they filled it with the rice pudding. Yummy... The next day we had to go back. This time I tried the frozen vanilla yogurt with caramel sauce and my daughter went back and ordered the coconut rice pudding with chocolate sauce again. While the yogurt was good, I'd recommend the rice pudding over the yogurt any day. Or just order a cup of that awesome caramel sauce :)
author: Edie U.

description: Frozen yogurt is usually a mixed bag for me but I actually quite liked Loving Cup, plus there was no line (unlike Smitten's hah!) but what I like about them is that they blend everything you want together so there aren't any chunks (so if you like your FroYo with chunks, stay away!). I got one with nutella and it was divine haha. I don't remember what else was in it, but the nutella. Would definitely come back for some more nutella FroYo!
author: Christina C.

description: Bigger location than the one on Polk, loving cup is like the cold stone creamery for froyo.  I wish that it is blended better so that its not icey.
author: Wakako U.

description: I love this place. I like to get vanilla with graham crackers and bananas. It's always so bomb. Plus, it's in one of the cutest neighbourhoods in SF and the decor is perfection.
author: Cj G.

description: The Salty Dog may end up being my downfall. I daydream about it. The place is no great shakes -- just a few benches, like a standard ice cream shop. It's just as easy to get it to go and hang in the park.
author: Jack L.

description: Try the pumpkin pie froyo while they have it this fall!!! I went with it because it's seasonal, but I sampled the oreo rice pudding, which was amaaaaazing. Dirty hipster also sounds really good. So glad I don't live walking distance to this place...that would be dangerous!
author: Sofia M.

description:
Welcome to Hayes Valley, Loving Cup!

I am already a fan of their best selling vanilla bean rice pudding! So excited when I found out that they are opening a new location in my favorite neighborhood of hayes valley. They have the best rice pudding! I have still yet to try their frozen yogurts. I am sure that it will be just as delicious as their rice pudding! Great addition to the neighborhood!
author: J C.

description:
i love loving cup.

after getting the runaround from schulzies--eagerly anticipating their arrival only to be extremely let down--i was hoping that loving cup would deliver, based on the deliciousness i experienced at the nob hill location. verdict: they did not disappoint. but then again, how could they, with 8+ flavors of rice pudding and, like, 30 toppings for frozen yogurt concoctions blended-to-order?

the particular location hasn't had much success with other businesses in the past, despite the apparent dedication, but i'm reeeeally hoping loving cup will. i might cry if they don't. and because there are still like 50 different yogurt concoctions i need to try...
author: stefanie h.

description: Delicious frozen yogurt! Loved that they blend all the toppings in with the fro-yo. I had the vanilla with raspberries, and man, it was fresh, tasty, delicious! I also had the churro rice krispy treat, fresh out of the oven, and man, I killed it!
author: Mary S.

description:
Great place. My favorites are chocolate froyo with cookie dough and almond butter, and the cookies'n'cream rice pudding.

When I first found this place, I was obsessed with it. I've been there probably ten times over the past year, and I'm sort of over it, but that's just me. It's still a fun and tasty place.

The only thing I don't like is the tablet they use. They scan your credit card and then turn around a big screen that says "How much do you want to tip?" with a couple amounts and a big red zero at the bottom with an asterisk that says you're a terrible person and everyone is judging you right now. Ok so maybe that last part isn't explicit, but the idea is obviously to guilt trip you into paying more than $5 for your little ice cream cup and I don't appreciate it.
author: Chris M.

description: Bland, over priced and a rather childish atmosphere makes it possibly good for the tween set, but not Al that great for adults. Servings are heavy and huge.
author: Antonia T.

description: So it's delicious... like really really good, but the hipster service is a bit snooty, they charge you a fee if you try to use a credit card under $5 and it's expensive for very little ice cream. I've only had the yogurt, I ordered a small dirty hipster and enjoyed it as I walked around the neighborhood. I will definitely be back because it's addicting and I want to try the rice pudding but I'd suggest more friendliness from staff please!
author: Madeline S.

description: Pretty awesome spot, with super customizable offerings, everything from chocolate to rice pudding (which btw is yuck, from here or anywhere). They are a fun store too, good atmosphere and pretty quick turn around. My only complaint is that the fro-yo isn't rich enough for my wants, but the fact that you can put in everything you ever wanted makes it quite tasty!
author: Ezra B.

description: Oh my god. This is probably the best froyo I've ever had. I got a vanilla base with almond butter and banana, and it was amazing. I went close to their closing time, so it wasn't very crowded, but the place isn't that large so I could imagine it getting a little cramped while busy. The amount of combinations you can choose are a little overwhelming, but seriously, it's awesome. (They also play cool music).
author: Lauren F.

description: The owner Liz reached out to me after reading about my experience. Very professional and thoughtful. Will update review again when I have time to go back to try their dessert.
author: Ame C.

description: I love rice pudding so I was really excited about this place! I wish they had more flavors though or changed them up a bit
author: Page F.

description: Not a typical froyo place. Their froyo is super creamy and mixing in delicious ingredients makes it very unique. I'm a huge fan!
author: Samantha K.

description: Very long wait, froyo nothing amazing and annoying heavy metal blasting insanely loud!
author: Cynthia T.

description: I absolutely love this place that I went twice in a row! The flavour with almond butter was really good. There's also wifi so it's a great sit down spot for travellers.
author: Susan K.

description: This was our first time here and boy was it amazing!!!!! They have such a big selection to choose from. Staff was very helpful. Can't wait to go back
author: Crystal C.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! The Loving Cup is sure to become my bad vice! I love it all, the location, the space design, the friendly service. I like pudding, specifically the flavors they offer, but what I LOVE is the blended frozen yogurt. I am a local in the hood and tonight was my first visit. I chose the toasted coconut, almond butter, chocolate fro-yo blend and it was insanely YUM! I cant wait to go back for the cinammon crunch fro-yo and the mocha chip fro-yo and the thin mint and well you get my drift. This place is a must if you like this sort of thing! In moderation , of course :)
author: Leila B.

description: Amazing non-fat frozen yogurt. They only have vanilla or chocolate but they will blend in frozen ingredients like fruits and nuts which gives the fro yo a delicious natural flavor. The first blended ingredient is free- I highly recommend the vanilla fro yo with banana, although pistachios were also tasty.
author: Madhu A.

description: Most hearty, fresh, and friendly froyo place I've every been to. I had the vanilla blended with blueberries and toasted coconut flakes. It was to die for and totally Instagram worthy. Definitely make a stop if you are in Hayes Valley!
author: Helen L.

description: Great!  Don't get the large, it's a lot bigger than it looks! Starters were really good.
author: Himanshu C.

description: OMG!! How have I missed this place before?!?!?! Walking distance to the Opera, Symphony & San Francisco Ballet, I can't believe I have not come here before. I've usually stopped in at other places closer, but these frozen yogurts are OUT OF THIS WORLD!! And so is the rice pudding!! They also do hand-poured coffee, & have espresso as well for those of you needing the extra lead. I will becoming a regular here. They even have discount cards where after 9 purchases your 10th is free! Hello Loving Cup - I love you!!
author: Sara O.

description: Yummy option is Hayes Valley.  Mix and match flavors to your heart's content.  Friendly service as well.
author: Heather R.

description: The cookies and cream rice pudding was awesome and the frozen yogurt combinations make this place great for any frozen yogurt loving person.
author: Keyan K.
